and appeals a creation the south daytona board of adjustments and appeals boaa is hereby created and shall have such powers duties responsibilities limitations rules and membership as hereinafter set forth b powers and duties the board of adjustments and appeals shall hear and decide 1 appeal of administrative orders to hear and decide appeals when it is alleged that there is an error in any order requirement decision or determination made by an administrative official in the enforcement of any provision of the land development an appeal shall be made within 30 days after the order requirement decision or determination is issued the appeal shall be in the form prescribed by the rules of the board in exercising its powers the board may upon appeal and in conformity with provisions of this ordinance reverse or affirm wholly or partly or may modify the order requirement decision or determination made by an administrative official in the enforcement of this may make any necessary order requirement decision or determination and to that end shall have all the powers of the officer from whom the appeal is made 2 variances to authorize upon appeal such variance from the terms of this will not be contrary to the public interest when owing to special conditions a literal enforcement of the provisions of the result in unnecessary and undue hardship in order to authorize any variance from the terms of this the board must find that the following criteria are met a that special conditions and circumstances exist which are peculiar to the land structure or building involved and which are not applicable to other lands structures or buildings in the same zoning district  b that the special conditions and circumstances do not result from the actions of the applicant  c that granting the variance requested will not confer on the applicant any special privilege that is denied by this other lands buildings or structures in the same zoning district  d that literal interpretation of the provisions of the deprive the applicant of rights commonly enjoyed by other properties in the same zoning district under the terms of this would work unnecessary and undue hardship on the applicant  e that the variance granted is the minimum variance that will make possible the reasonable use of the land building or structure  f that the granting of the variance will be in harmony with the general intent and purpose of the that such variance will not be injurious to the area involved or otherwise be detrimental to the public welfare in granting a variance the board may prescribe appropriate conditions and safeguards in conformity with this article and any code enacted under its authority violations of such conditions and safeguards when made a part of the terms under which the variance is granted shall be deemed a violation of this board may prescribe a reasonable time limit within which the action for which the variance is required shall begin or be completed or both however unless otherwise prescribed by the board a variance for which construction has not commenced pursuant thereto within 365 days of its issuance shall become void unless extended or reapproved by the board lapse of a variance by the passage of time shall not preclude subsequent application for variance under no circumstances shall the board grant a variance to permit a use not generally or by special conditions permitted in the zoning district involved or any use expressly or by implication prohibited by the terms of this the zoning district no nonconforming use of neighboring lands structures or buildings in the same zoning district and no permitted use of lands structures or buildings in the same zoning district and no permitted use of lands structures or buildings in other zoning districts shall be considered grounds for the authorization of a variance 3 variances of flood hazard requirements a upon the submission of a written application to the boaa a variance may be granted permitting the erection of structures with a lowest flood elevation including basement lower than regulatory flood elevation if all of the following criteria are met  the property on which the structure is to be erected is an isolated lot of onehalf acre or less contiguous to and surrounded by existing structures constructed below such required first floor elevation or the property is a structure to be restored or reconstructed and is listed in the national register of historic places or a state inventory of historic places   good and sufficient cause exists for the granting of the variance   failure to grant the variance would result in exceptional hardship to the applicant   the issuance of the variance would not result in increased flood heights additional threats to public safety or extraordinary public expense   the variance allowed is the minimum necessary to afford relief   the variance would not have the effect of nullifying the intent and purposes of this article b all applications for variances shall be heard by the board after reference to such committees and administrative officials as may be established for purposes of investigation and recommendation c prior to the granting of a variance the board must find that justification exists in accordance with the terms of this article these findings together with the grant of a variance shall be reduced to writing and made a part of the municipal records any variance shall pertain to the particular parcel of land and apply only to the proposed structure set forth in the variance application d any variance shall be freely transferable with the land and shall not be personal to the applicant e unless otherwise provided therein a variance shall be valid for a period of one year after the date of its issuance if construction has not commenced pursuant thereto within such time said variance shall become void lapse of a variance by the passage of time shall not preclude subsequent application for variance f no variance except as herein specifically permitted may be granted from the provisions of this article the variance procedures herein provided shall be the exclusive method for obtaining variances under the provisions herein g each written application for a variance shall be accompanied by the applicable application fee and shall reflect the type of structures for which a variance is sought the size of such structures the approximate location upon the parcel and the intended use thereof h due to the extremely hazardous conditions within the floodway and the effect of obstructions on upstream structures no variance shall be issued within the designated floodway which results in any increase in flood levels during the regulatory flood discharge 4 evaluation of request for accommodation under the fair housing act a a request may be made by the property owner or authorized representative for a request for an accommodation from the citys rules policy practices or service to allow a handicapped person or persons to have equal opportunity to use and enjoy a dwelling the request shall be on an approved form issued by the city and must contain the following  proof of ownership of the property which the request is being made or authorization from the property owner  specifically identify the rules policies practices or services from which relief is being requested  identify the nature of the disability of the occupants of the dwelling  outline the minimum relief that is necessary to allow a handicapped person to use and enjoy the dwelling  describe in detail how the requested relief is necessary to allow a person with the aboveidentified disability to be able to reasonably use and enjoy the dwelling  access must be granted to the necessary city employees to inspect the dwelling b the city shall evaluate all necessary criteria facts rules laws etc to make a determination as to whether the requested accommodation is reasonable including but not limited to  the policies and objectives of the citys comprehensive plan including the future land use designation of the property in question  the permitted uses conditional uses and special exceptions allowed for the zoning designation of the property in question  the surrounding neighborhood including zoning and future land use designations of the surrounding area  the capacity of existing city utilities and infrastructures to accommodate the requested use  existing traffic patterns and traffic problems in the area that currently exist or may become a problem if the requested relief was granted  potential for noise dust or other impacts to the neighborhood  ability of the existing dwelling to accommodate the requested variation including bedrooms bathrooms outside parking and existing compliance with current building codes to determine the existence of any life and safety issues  the existence of any current code violations c an appeal stays all work an appeal to the boaa stays all work on the premises unless the chief building official certifies that by reason of fact stated in the certificate a stay would cause imminent peril to life or property in such case proceedings or work shall not be stayed except by a restraining order which may be granted by the city council or by a court of record on application d hearingsfees the boaa shall hear the appeals at their next regularly scheduled meeting or the chairman may call a special meeting if arranged at the hearing the applicant shall appear in person or be represented by authorized agent or attorney the appellant may be required to assume such reasonable costs in connection with such hearings as may be prescribed by city council resolution e review of decisions of the board of adjustments and appeals any person affected by any decision of the boaa who wishes to appeal that decision may seek judicial review as provided by florida statutes such appeal must be filed within 30 days from the date of action taken by the boaa f composition the boaa shall consist of seven members members of the board shall be appointed by the city council in addition the city council may appoint two alternate members designating them as such such alternate members may act in the temporary absence or disability of any regular member or may act when a regular member is otherwise disqualified in a particular case that may be presented to the board no member of the board shall be a paid or elected official or employee of the city to the extent possible the board shall be composed of one architect one engineer two general contractors with combined expertise of the above members in building plumbing electrical fire safety and mechanical construction standards and one member of the public to the extent possible each member shall be a resident of the city of south daytona g terms of office removal from office vacancies members of the board shall serve for overlapping terms of three years or thereafter until their successors are appointed not more than three of the terms of such members shall expire in any one year alternate members shall serve a term of one year all members shall serve at the pleasure of the city council and may be removed without cause a member shall immediately forfeit appointment if she 1 lacks at any time during his term of appointment any qualifications of the appointment as prescribed by charter or law  or 2 violates any express prohibition of the charter or law  or 3 is convicted of a felony or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude  or 4 has unexcused absences for two successive meetings  or three unexcused absences within a 12month period  or requires more than three excused absences within a 12month period any vacancy occurring during the unexpired term of office of any member shall be filled by the city council for the remainder of the term h officers rules of procedure employees and salaries the board shall elect a chairman and a vice chairman from among its members and shall appoint a secretary who may be an officer or employee of the city the board may create and fill such other offices as it may determine to be necessary for the conduct of its duties terms of all such offices shall be for one year with eligibility for reelection the board shall adopt rules for transaction of its business and shall keep a record of its resolutions transactions findings and determinations which record shall be a public record meetings of the board shall be held at the call of the chairman and at such times as the board may determine in any event each board shall meet within 20 days after notice of appeal has been received every decision shall be promptly filed in writing in the office of the administrative official and shall be open to public inspection a certified copy shall be sent by mail or otherwise to the appellant and a copy shall be kept publicly posted in the office of the administrative official for two weeks after filing i appropriations fees and other income the city council may appropriate such funds as it may see fit for salaries fees and expenses necessary in the conduct of the work of the board the city council by action taken at any regular or special meeting of the council and recorded in the minutes of the meeting may establish and from time to time amend a schedule of fees to be charged by the board the board shall have the authority to expend all sums so appropriated and other sums made available for its use from fees and other sources for the purposes and activities for which it is created j quorum four members of the board shall constitute a quorum in varying the application of any provisions of the in modifying an order of the administrative official affirmative votes of the majority present but not less than four affirmative votes shall be required  5807   22608 department of community development the department of community development may consist of the planning ldrb and city council review the intent of this section is to ensure that adequate and necessary physical improvements of lasting quality will be installed  to provide for safe and convenient traffic circulation  to provide an efficient adequate and economic supply of utilities and services to new land developments  to prevent seasonal flooding of protective flood control and drainage facilities  to help conserve and protect physical environmental and scenic resources  to promote the public health safety comfort convenience and general welfare  and to implement the citys comprehensive plan b incorporated herein nonconforming provisions a types of nonconforming status within the districts established by this or amendments that may later be adopted there may exist uses of land or structures which lawfully existed before this passed or amended but which would be prohibited regulated or restricted under the terms of this is the intent of this permit these nonconformities to continue in their present condition but not be enlarged upon expanded or extended nor be used as grounds for adding other structures or uses prohibited elsewhere in the same district b nonconforming lots of record where two or more adjacent nonconforming lots are under the same ownership or where a nonconforming lot is adjacent to a conforming lot under the same ownership such lot or lots shall be combined to form a single lot in compliance or as close thereto as possible with the then existing regulations if such joinder will result in a lessening of the nonconformity as long as the above provision is complied with when applicable in any singlefamily residential district notwithstanding district lot width or area requirements a singlefamily dwelling and customary accessory buildings may be erected on any single lot of record as defined herein which existed at the effective date of adoption or amendment of the provision shall apply even though such lot fails to meet the requirements applying to area or width or both of the lot as long as said lot conforms to all other regulations for district in which such lot is located on nonconforming lots of record zoned commercial or industrial on the effective date of this ordinance one commercial or industrial building shall be permitted provided that no adjoining lots are in the same ownership or were in the same ownership at the effective date of this ordinance no portion of any nonconforming lot shall be sold or used in a manner which diminishes compliance with lot width and area requirements established by this nor shall any division of any parcel be made which creates a lot width or area below the requirements statements stated in this nonconforming uses of land and structures the use of any building or structure not in conformance with these regulations pertaining to uses permitted on the effective date of this ordinance may not be 1 changed to another nonconforming use 2 reestablished after this future development or expansion of these existing structures shall be regulated by dimensional requirements of this nonconforming structure existing prior to the adoption of this continue to have such nonconforming status and shall be subject to the applicable provisions of this including the following which shall apply so long as the use of land or structure remains otherwise lawful 1 no such nonconforming structure may be enlarged or altered in a way which increases its nonconformity but any structure or portion thereof may be altered to decrease its nonconformity 2 should such nonconforming structure or nonconforming portion of structure be destroyed by any means to an extent of more than 50 percent of its current assessed value as recorded in the volusia county property appraisers office at the time of destruction it shall not be reconstructed except in conformity with the provisions of this should such structure be moved for any reason for any distance whatever it shall thereafter conform to the regulations of the district in which it is located after it is removed e nonconforming mobile home uses and structures 1 in a mobile home park or a mobile home subdivision which constitutes a nonconforming use or contains nonconforming structures and the nonconformity cannot be completely corrected a mobile home may be replaced if the replacement mobile home automatic fire sprinkler system sufficient to meet city standards 2 the city shall waive the plumbing and electrical permit fees for any individual who elects to have the replacement mobile home equipped with an automatic fire sprinkler system as set forth in paragraph 1 above 3 a mobile home which constitutes a nonconforming use that is located on property other than in a mobile home park or mobile home subdivision cannot be replaced once the mobile home is removed from its location 4 except as specifically provided in this section mobile home parks and mobile home subdivisions which are either nonconforming uses or contain nonconforming structures shall be governed by the regulations and restrictions as set forth in the nonconforming provisions of the land development code or as set forth by statutory or case law f repairs and maintenance on any nonconforming structure or portion of a structure containing a nonconforming use repairs and modernization are permitted provided that the cubic area existing when it became nonconforming shall not be increased nothing in this be deemed to prevent the strengthening or restoring to a safe condition of any building or part thereof as determined by the comprehensive plan or this 2  concurrency management system a purpose the purpose of the concurrency management system cms described herein is to enable the city to comply with section  g of the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act fs which requires that the city implement local land development regulations which provide that public facilities and services meet or exceed the standards established in the capital improvements element of the comprehensive plan and are available when needed to meet the impacts of development and that not later than one year after the official due date of the citys comprehensive plan the city shall not issue a development order or permit resulting in a reduction in the levelofservice los for affected public facilities below the levelofservice adopted by the comprehensive plan the city also intends that the cms be consistent with rule 9j fac which provides guidelines to local governments for the preparation and implementation of a cms which will ensure the availability of public facilities and services concurrent with the impacts of development to ensure that facilities and services needed to support development are available concurrent with the impacts of such development a local government must adopt a concurrency management system the citys concurrency management system shall measure the potential impact of any proposed development upon the levelsofservice for potable water sanitary sewer solid waste parks and recreation drainage and roadways by comparing that impact with available capacity and the citys adopted levelofservice standards for those public facilities no final development permit shall be approved unless the city has determined use of this mechanism that adequate public facilities will be available at the time of project impact b intent the city intends that the cms be functionally compatible with the citys character as an already substantially builtout municipality with virtually no potential for urban sprawl within a surrounding urban core this means that virtually all new development may be characterized as infill and its impact on facility levelsofservice should be relatively minor the city intends that the concurrency management system provide the basic principles and guidelines for its implementation however it is not the intent of the city that the ordinance contain all of the detailed administrative procedures required for the daytoday operation of the program instead the city desires that city officials responsible for the cms possess a certain degree of flexibility and latitude to develop and employ such additional procedures forms etc as they deem necessary for carrying out an effective and efficient concurrency management system the city manager may develop as an administrative policy a concurrency manual or guide to assist city officials in the daytoday administration of the program  such a document would provide more detail than the ordinance concerning administrative procedures it is not the intent of the city that the concurrency management system in any of its aspects including concurrency evaluation and the issuance of concurrency compliance determinations replace any other development review criteria used by the city unless those criteria are inconsistent with the provisions of the concurrency management ordinance the cms is designed to primarily complement and not to replace the other review criteria c basic principles 1 the cms will formally take effect on the date specified in the adopting ordinance 2 each year in september the city shall verify by capacity reservation certifications from the following provider entities for the public facilities indicated city of daytona beachpotable water and sanitary sewer  volusia countysolid waste these statements shall cover at least the fiscal year starting october 1 and the fiveyear period starting with that fiscal year 3 each year in september the city shall issue its own capacity reservation certifications to cover the succeeding fiscal year and the following four fiscal years a total of five fiscal years for the following public facilities roadways parks and recreation 4 each year in september the city shall issue its own drainage certification to cover the succeeding fiscal year and the following four fiscal years a total of five fiscal years to cover onsite drainage facilities 5 concurrency review for a specific project will begin at the time of application for development approval a determination of concurrency will be made at the time the application is submitted once capacity has been determined to be available this capacity will be reserved and ultimately a capacity award will be made based on the table 1 presented in  for each development application a concurrency compliance review form ccrf shall be completed processed and filed see figure 4 7 the concurrency compliance review form establishes the service capacity reserved for that project this capacity is reserved for the time period shown on the following chart when a final development order is issued this reservation shall be awarded issuance of a concurrency compliance certification this certification shall remain valid for the time period shown on the following chart if a capacity reservation cannot be made for one or more critical facilities a concurrency compliance certification shall not be issued for the project for those projects requiring several approvals the reservation of capacity may occur at a different time than the final award of capacity table 1 south daytona development capacity management process capacity reservation reservation expiration capacity award capacity expiration building permit approval by cbo 2 months issuance and delivery 6 months subdivision approval ldrb concept plat approval 12 months city council final plat approval 24 months site plan approval drc review 6 months drc approval 12 months 8 impacts of phased projects shall be evaluated based on the phased development schedule capacity reservations and approvals may only be given for those phases occurring within the capital facilities horizon and capacity awards may only be given as set forth in above d criteria for concurrency evaluation of public facilities the following criteria will be used in conjunction with the concurrency compliance review form to evaluate the impact of proposed projects on public facilities it should be noted however that for selected public facilitiesie potable water sanitary sewer and solid wasteoverall citywide demand needed capacity will be calculated based upon population estimates and projections generated annually by the bureau of economic and business research of the university of florida bebr this calculation will be done once per year in september by multiplying the given population level for a particular target year by the adopted levelofservice standard a per capita figure  then the citywide demand will be compared with the reserved capacity allocated by the provider for the period in question  if the citywide demand is less than the available capacity there shall be no adverse impact on the lossie there shall be no concurrency problem or deficiency even in these cases however projectbyproject impact shall be calculated evaluated recorded and tracked to assure that the actual cumulative demandimpact does not exceed the available capacity for any relevant time period  the use of the ccrf form is essential for this process 1 roadway facilities a roadway capacity will be evaluated using the florida highway system plan levelofservice standards and guidelines issued by fdot and effective jan 1 1989 and as subsequently modified traffic modeling when required shall use the fsutms model b properties serviced by local roadways located within a recorded subdivision plat will be evaluated for impact at the nearest point of ingressegress to the roadway network c the impact on the roadway system will be determined by using the tripgeneration standards contained in the volusia county impact fee ordinance #866 as amended the estimated trips generated by the proposed project will be subtracted cumulatively from the available capacity on the roadway to determine whether roadway capacity is adequate to support the project based upon the resultant los in comparison with the citys adopted loss for the roadway in question d if no official traffic count exists for a collector or arterial the city will provide the count within a reasonable period unless it is arranged for by the applicant if the city provides the count the cost may be passed on to the applicant e calculation of total traffic to be generated by a proposed project will assume 100 percent buildout and occupancy credits against the trips generated by nonresidential land uses will be applied using the percentages employed by the volusia county impact fee system any claimed credit for capture of trips from passing traffic in excess of these percentages must be justified by the applicant any claimed credit for internal absorption of trips for a mixeduse development must also be justified by the applicant f proposed development which generates 100 or fewer average daily trips shall not be subject to an individual concurrency certification trips generated by projects below the threshold level shall be recorded and applied to the traffic circulation network as part of the annual certification process g proposed development which generates 500 or more average daily trips shall submit a traffic impact analysis at the time an application for development approval is filed this traffic analysis shall at a minimum include an analysis generated by the vcog traffic analysis system h evaluation of the impact of proposed development upon roadway levelsofservice must take into consideration both the relative impact from adjoining jurisdictions and the relative responsibility of various jurisdictions to provide for improvements this is particularly true for the following state roads nova road beville road and ridgewood avenue us highway 1 over which the fdot has primary jurisdiction and responsibility for financing needed improvements to the extent that planned improvements are behind schedule on these roadways due to no fault of the city nova road is a notable case in point the city should not be unduly and unfairly restricted from approving a limited amount of development so long as it does not substantially degrade the existing level ofservice additional traffic permitted on backlogged facilities will be governed by the level of services limits set by policy 18 of the adopted traffic circulation element of the south daytona comprehensive plan i levelsofservice on local roadways within the city shall not be allowed to deteriorate to a levelof service below the adopted c levelofservice standard for all local roadways j in augustseptember of each year the city will discuss and coordinate roadway levelofservice issues with those entities either having primary responsibility for the roadways or directly affected by them ie volusia county fdot local mpo daytona beach port orange and daytona beach shores k in september of each year after coordinating with affected entities the city will issue a roadway capacity reservation certification to cover both the following fiscal year and every succeeding year of the fiveyear period which begins with that initial fiscal year this certification will indicate the specific capacity levels which will be allowed for each roadway within the city limits plus beville road 2 potable water facilities in september of each year the city will obtain a potable water capacity reservation certification from the city of daytona beach this certification will cover at least the following fiscal year and the fiveyear period which starts with that fiscal year it will be based upon the projected city population for the periods in question multiplied by the projected city demand in gallons per capita ie the citys adopted levelofservice standard for potable water facilities the impact of a specific project will be calculated by determining the year of impact and then multiplying the population of the project at that point in time by the projected demand per capita ie the citys adopted levelofservice standard for potable water facilities  then that final demand at impact for the project will be added to the final demand for any other proposed projects and the cumulative total will be compared to the potable water capacity reservation certification to determine capacity availability for the specific project in addition all projects must be reviewed as to the adequacy of water pressure and water storage capacity according to the citys adopted levelofservice standards for those parameters 3 sanitary sewer facilities in september of each year the city will obtain a sanitary sewer capacity reservation certification from the city of daytona beach this certification will cover at least the following fiscal year and the fiveyear period which starts with that fiscal year it will be based upon the projected city population for the periods in question multiplied by the projected city flow in gallons per capita ie the citys adopted levelofservice standard for sanitary sewer facilities the impact of a specific project will be calculated by determining the year of impact and then multiplying the population of the project at that point in time by the projected flow per capita ie the citys adopted levelof service standard for sanitary sewer facilities  then that final demand at impact for the project will be added to the final demand for any other proposed projects and the cumulative total will be compared to the sanitary sewer capacity reservation certification to determine capacity availability for the specific project 4 solid waste facilities in september of each year the city will obtain a solid waste capacity reservation certification from volusia county this certification will cover at least both the following fiscal year and the fiveyear period which starts with that fiscal year it will be based upon the projected city population for the periods in question multiplied by the projected city disposal in pounds per capita ie the citys adopted levelofservice standard for solid waste facilities the impact of a specific project will be calculated by determining the year of impact and then multiplying the population of the project at that a point in time by the projected disposal per capita ie the citys adopted levelofservice standard for solid waste facilities then that final demand at impact for the project will be added to the final demand for any other proposed projects and the cumulative total will be compared to the solid waste capacity reservation certification to determine capacity availability for the specific project 5 drainage facilities in september of each year the city will issue its own one and fiveyear drainage facility adequacy certification which will state that concurrency compliance is assumed based upon the citys enforcement of its adopted levelofservice standard for onsite drainage 6 park and recreation facilities in september of each year the city will issue its own recreation capacity reservation certification this certification will cover at least both the following fiscal year and the fiveyear period on a yearbyyear basis which starts with that fiscal year it will be based upon the projected city population in 1000s for the periods in question multiplied by the citys adopted levelofservice standards units per 1000 for recreation facilities the impact of a specific project will be calculated by determining the year of impact and then multiplying the population of the project in 1000s at that point in time by the citys adopted levelofservice standards units per 1000 for recreation facilities  then that final demand at impact for the project will be added to the final demand for any other projects proposed for the same fiscal year and the cumulative total will be compared to the recreation capacity reservation certification for the time period in question to determine capacity availability for the specific project e projected need for additional facilities to meet concurrency requirement 1 in the event that the citys concurrency analysis reveals that proposed or projected development will result in a concurrency deficiency in any one or more of the six types of critical public facilities for a particular fiscal year of project impact the city must make sure that there is a financial or other legally binding commitment to correct the deficiency before it makes a finding of concurrency compliance on specific affected projects this will require either the inclusion of timely remedial funding in the citys annual capital improvement programs budget developer commitment legally binding to provide remedial funding or some other legally binding obligation to correct the deficiency in a timely manner 2 in the event that a development order or permit should not otherwise be issued due to the unavailability of adequate funding for necessary public facilities the city will allow the developer to provide the facilities at his own expense contingent upon the public facilities to be provided must not be inconsistent with the schedule of capital improvements in the comprehensive plan  the city and the developer must execute an enforceable development agreement which includes a construction schedule and a monitoring mechanism and penalty clauses in case of noncompliance to ensure concurrency however mere availability of public facility capacity for a proposed project even if such availability is provided totally financing is not in itself sufficient justification for project approval  all of the citys project review criteria must be satisfied before the project can be approved 3 in the event that available facility capacity will be insufficient to serve all competing development applications impacting in a given fiscal year and being reviewed simultaneously the city will complete its review process and then prioritize the approval applications and it will approve them in rank order only to the extent that it is determined that concurrent capacity will be available approvable applications will be ranked on a first come first served basis by date of application in chronological order 4 in the event that a project is rejected either because capacity is unavailable for it or ranking procedure described in the preceding paragraph the city reserves the right to exercise the following options deny the project  or defer the project  or require project modification  or conditionally approve the project if the project is denied or deferred the applicant will be given the opportunity to leave his application on file or to resubmit it when facility capacity becomes available such applications will be given chronological priority over subsequent applications but must be reviewed for full concurrency compliance if more than 45 days elapse between denialdeferral and reconsideration f vested rights vested means that a property is not subject to concurrency requirements because it was approved on or before  the date of adoption of the citys comprehensive plan existing vacant residential commercial industrial and public buildings are considered vested vacant singlefamily building lots in platted and recorded subdivisions are considered vested this means that any homes built upon those lots are also vested other projects must have had an active building permit as of  to be considered vested g last resort provision as a last resort measure the city reserves the right to deny delay or conditionally approve any development application or permit which would otherwise be issuable if the project review process clearly demonstrates based upon convincing reasoning and documentation that approval would adversely impact the levelsof service of critical public facilities in such a way as to pose a clear threat to the health safety or welfare of the community h capacity reservation fee the city council may establish a capacity reservation fee in recognition of the value inherent in the reservation of service capacity for a specific development for a stated period of time the award of the capacity reservation prevents the city from awarding this same capacity to another project the specific fee will be established by resolution i no later than august or september of each fiscal year the concurrency manager will provide a report to the city council which evaluates the past performance of the cms and if needed makes recommendations for improvement this report may be combined with any other related report which must be issued during the same period j administration although the city council has the ultimate responsibility for the implementation of the cms various city agencies and officials carry out functions in the program the city manager as concurrency manager provides administrative oversight for the program however the community development directorchief building official will be responsible for the daytoday concurrency management decisions such as concurrency evaluations and the issuance of concurrency compliance certifications and building permits such agencies as the land development regulation board ldrb with respect to the comprehensive plan subdivision review and concurrency appeals and the board of adjustment with respect to other appeals will exercise their statutory functions in the administrative process k appeals 1 except as otherwise provided in the city appeals from concurrency determinations of city officials or agencies shall be taken before the land development regulation board ldrb any such appeal must be filed in writing with the community development director cdd within 20 calendar days of rendition of the decision in question and the reasons for such appeal shall be set forth therein the cdd shall arrange for an appeal hearing before the ldrb and shall notify the appellant in writing of the date time and place of the hearing 2 the appellant shall have the burden of affirmatively demonstrating that the decision of the city officials was in error said officials shall have the opportunity to present information and argument to support the citys decision 3 the board shall base its decision on the citys comprehensive plan and concurrency management regulations and it shall make its decision employing its usual voting procedures the decision shall be issued in writing stating the reasoning involved and it shall be rendered within 60 days of the close of the hearing 4 in the event that either the appellant or the concurrency manager wishes to appeal the matter further that may be done to the city council by filing a written appeal setting forth the reasons therefore with the city clerk within 20 calendar days after rendition of the decision by the board the city clerk shall arrange for a hearing before the city council and shall notify the appellant in writing of the date time and place of the hearing consideration shall be limited to the record established before the board and argument of the parties involved the city council shall base its decision on applicable laws and regulations it shall make its decision using its usual voting procedures the decision shall be issued in writing stating the reasoning involved and it shall be rendered within 60 days of the close of the hearing no further administrative appeal is available beyond this stage though the appellant retains the right of appeal judicial system statements on intergovernmental coordination the intergovernmental matrix table ____________  ____________  ____________ proportionate fairshare transportation regulations i short title authority and applicability a this section shall be known as the proportionate fairshare transportation regulations b the city council is required to adopt this section in accordance with the provisions of fs   16 c the provisions of this section shall apply to all developments within the city of south daytona that impact a major roadway segment which has failed to achieve transportation concurrency by having a levelofservice below that adopted by the entity whether city county or state having competent jurisdiction d the provisions of this section shall not apply to developments of regional impact dris or to developments exempted from concurrency or to developments creating de minimis impacts ii purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this section is to establish a method for mitigating the impacts of development on transportation facilities cooperative efforts of the public and private sectors more specifically the proportionate fairshare mechanism is intended to enable developers to meet transportation concurrency requirements by paying their proportionate fair share of the cost of roadway improvements impacted by their proposed developments iii definitions for the purpose of this section the following terms shall be defined as follows unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning a capital improvements the outlay of capital of funds for the planning of engineering of acquisition of materials for acquisition of land for and construction of roads related pedestrianbikeways turn lanes intersection improvements and signalization  this does not include maintenance b capital improvements plan the fiveyear capital improvements schedule contained in the comprehensive plan of the city of south daytona c developer any persons or entity whether public or private undertaking the development of land d fairshare transportation facilities fee the fee required to be paid by a developer in accordance with the terms of this section proportionate fairshare transportation regulations e land the earth water and air above below or on the surface which term includes any improvements or structures customarily regarded as land f land development activity generating traffic the conduct of any building activity or the making of any material change in the use of any land or structure that attracts or produces vehicular trips over and above those produced by the existing state of the land consequently placing an additional demand on the major roadway network g major roadway network all arterial and collector roadways within the city including any such proposed roads necessitated by new development activity generating vehicular traffic iv general requirements a a developer may choose to satisfy the transportation concurrency requirements of the city by making a proportionate fairshare contribution pursuant to the following requirements 1 the proposed development is consistent with the comprehensive plan and applicable land development regulations  and 2 the fiveyear capital improvements schedule in the capital improvements element of the comprehensive plan includes a transportation capital improvement that upon completion will accommodate the additional traffic generated by the proposed development b the city may choose to allow a developer to satisfy transportation concurrency requirements by making a proportionate fairshare contribution to an improvement that upon completion will accommodate the additional traffic generated by the proposed development which improvement is not contained in the fiveyear capital improvements schedule and one of the following conditions applies 1 the city adds the improvement to the fiveyear capital improvements schedule no later than the next regular capital improvements schedule update of the comprehensive plan provided that the improvement is financially feasible as defined by fs   16b1  or 2 if the funds in the fiveyear capital improvements schedule are insufficient to fully fund the construction of the improvement the city may enter into a proportionate fairshare agreement with the developer authorizing construction of that amount of development upon which the proportionate fairshare amount is calculated if the proportionate fairshare amount in such agreement is sufficient to pay for one or more improvements which will in the opinion of the city council significantly benefit the impacted transportation system provided that said improvements are adopted into the fiveyear capital improvements schedule no later than the next regular capital improvements update of the comprehensive plan c any transportation capital improvement proposed to meet the developers proportionate fairshare obligation must meet the design standards of the city for citymaintained roads and the design standards of other applicable governmental entities for roads under their jurisdiction v application process a a developer who applies to commence any land development activity which would result in a failure of a road segment to meet transportation concurrency may apply to the city for a proportionate fairshare agreement b prior to submission of an application for a proportionate fairshare agreement a preapplication meeting shall be held with city staff to discuss eligibility application submittal requirements potential mitigation options and other relevant issues if the road segment that would fail to meet transportation concurrency is on the strategic intermodal system sis the florida dept of transportation fdot shall be requested to participate in the preapplication meeting  other directly affected jurisdictions may also be invited to participate in said meeting c application review procedures 1 the developer shall submit an application to the community development director that includes a nonrefundable application fee of $200000 which fee shall be credited toward what is ultimately determined to be the developers proportionate fairshare contribution plus the following a name address and contact information of the developer  b a survey and legal description of the land  c project schedule including phases if applicable  d description of the requested fairshare mitigation  e if the requested fairshare mitigation involves a road segment on the strategic intermodal system sis evidence of concurrence from fdot  and f traffic study performed by a licensed traffic engineer demonstrating failure of road segment to meet transportation concurrency 2 within 20 days of receipt of the application the community development director shall conduct his review of the application to determine its completeness if the application is not complete a written statement shall be sent to the developer delineating the deficiencies  if such deficiencies are not remedied by the developer within 30 days of receipt of the written notice then the application shall be deemed to be abandoned the community development director in his sole discretion may grant an extension to cure such deficiencies if the developer shows good cause and has taken reasonable steps to effect a cure 3 if the community development director determines that the application is complete he shall provide written notification of such to the developer and forward the application to the city attorney who shall within 30 days draft a proportionate fairshare agreement for consideration by the city council at a meeting to be held no later than 60 days from the date that the developer received notice that the application was complete 4 no proportionate fairshare agreement shall be effective until approved by the city council vi determination of proportionate fairshare obligation a proportionate fairshare mitigation may include without limitation separately or collectively private funds contributions of land and contributions of transportation facilities b the methodology used to calculate a developers proportionate fairshare obligation is represented by the following formula pursuant to fs  12 proportionate share   development tripssv increase  cost where development trips   those trips from the development that are assigned to the affected roadway segment sv increase   service volume increase provided by the improvement to the affected roadway segment cost   adjusted cost of the improvement c for the purpose of determining proportionate fairshare obligations improvement costs shall be based upon the actual cost of the improvement as obtained as appropriate from the citys fiveyear capital improvements schedule the transportation improvement program of the volusia county mpo the road program of the county of volusia or the work program of fdot if information is not available from such sources the improvement cost shall be determined using one of the following methods 1 an analysis by the community development department of costs adjusted by the fdot price trends index from the previous year by cross section type that incorporates data from recent projects  or 2 the most recent issue of the fdot transportation costs as adjusted based upon the type of cross section  locally available data from recent projects as to acquisition drainage and utility costs  and significant changes in the cost of materials due to unforeseeable events d if the city has accepted an improvement project proposed by the developer the value of the improvement shall be determined using one of the methods provided in this section e if the city has accepted rightofway dedication for the proportionate fairshare payment credit for the dedication of the nonsite related rightofway shall be valued as of the date of the dedication at 120 percent of the most recent assessed value by the volusia county property appraiser or with mutual agreement of the city and the developer by fair market value established by an independent appraisal approved by the city and not at city expense the developer shall supply to the city a certificate of title or title search of the land at no expense to the city if the estimated value of the rightofway dedication proposed by the developer is less than the cityestimated total proportionate fairshare obligation for the development then the developer must pay the difference vii transportation facilities impact fee credit a proportionate fairshare mitigation payments shall be applied as a credit against impact fees credits will be given for that portion of the impact fees that would have been used to fund the improvements upon which the proportionate fairshare contribution is calculated also if the proportionate fairshare contribution is based upon only a portion of the traffic generated by the development the credit will be limited to that portion of the impact fees upon which the proportionate fairshare contribution is based b at the time that the proportionate fairshare obligation is being determined the city will also compute the transportation facilities impact fee obligation for the proposed development if the developers proportionate fairshare obligation is less than the total transportation facilities impact fee anticipated for the development the developer must pay the difference to the city viii proportionate fairshare agreements a if the developer fails to apply for a building permit within one year of the date of execution of the proportionate fairshare agreement the agreement shall be considered null and void and the developer shall be required to reapply in accordance with the provisions of this section b payment of the proportionate fairshare contribution is due in full prior to issuance of the final development order or recording of the final plat and shall be nonrefundable if the payment is submitted after one year from the date of execution of the agreement the proportionate fairshare cost shall be recalculated at the time of payment based upon the best estimate of construction cost of the required improvement at the time of payment pursuant to these regulations and adjusted accordingly c developer improvements authorized herein involving dedications to the city must be completed upon final acceptance of the improvements and receipt of a warranty bond in a form approved by the city attorney d developer improvements authorized herein not involving dedications to the city must be completed upon recording of a final plat or upon issuance of a certificate of occupancy whichever occurs first e any requested change to a development project subsequent to the issuance of a development order will be subject to additional proportionate fairshare contributions to the extent that the change would generate additional traffic f a developer may present the city with a letter to withdraw from the proportionate fairshare agreement at any time prior to the execution of the agreement however the application fee paid to the city shall be nonrefundable ix appropriation of fairshare revenues a all proportionate fairshare revenues shall be placed in the appropriate project account for funding of improvements contained in the fiveyear capital improvements schedule or for use as might otherwise be established as per terms of the proportionate fairshare agreement b in the event that a scheduled transportation facility improvement is removed from the fiveyear capital improvements schedule then the revenues already collected for its construction shall be applied toward the construction of another improvement within the same transportation corridor that would mitigate the impacts of development as determined by the city council  121206 article v  zoning regulations general provisions a title these regulations shall be known as the zoning regulations or zoning  of the city of south daytona florida b purpose and intent these zoning regulations have been prepared with due consideration to existing conditions and future development of the city according to general policies expressed in the comprehensive land use plan as adopted by the city council on  and any subsequent amendments this article is designed to promote the health safety and general welfare of the citizens of the city by regulating the use and development of land and water 1 to provide for an efficient equitable economical and environmentally sound pattern of urban development  2 to secure safety from fire wind and other dangers  3 to provide adequate light and air and to prevent the overcrowding of land  4 to avoid undue concentration of population  and 5 to facilitate provision for adequate transportation water sewerage schools parks and other public needs  and 6 to place similar land uses together in the same district and to minimize incompatibilities between different adjoining land uses the zoning regulations and districts are developed in light of the aforementioned objectives and considering the character of the districts and their suitability for particular uses of land these regulations and districts work toward preserving desirable environmental features while allowing the greatest possible use and enjoyment of individual properties they strive to protect the values of buildings and land and the use and enjoyment of adjacent properties in general the zoning regulations regulate land use and land development with the overarching goal of promoting and protecting the public welfare c jurisdiction the provisions of this article shall apply inside the corporate limits of the city of south daytona florida establishment of districts and official zoning map a establishment of districts the city of south daytona florida is hereby divided into zoning districts as specified in this article and shown on the official zoning map of the city which together with all explanatory material therein is hereby adopted by reference and declared to be a part of these zoning regulations b official zoning map 1 identification of official map the official zoning map shall be identified by the signature of the mayor of the city of south daytona be attested by the city clerk and bear the seal of the city under the following words this is to certify that this is the official zoning map referred to in the zoning regulations of the city of south daytona florida 2 changes in district boundaries if in accordance with provisions of this article changes are made in district boundaries or other matter on the official zoning map such changes shall be recorded promptly on the map by inserting the date when the amendment was adopted the ordinance number adopting the amendment and the mayors signature attested by the city clerk in the spaces provided for such entries 3 official map final authority regardless of the existence of socalled versions and copies of the city zoning map which may from timetotime be made or published the official zoning map which shall be kept under the responsible charge of the city clerk shall be the final graphic authority as to the current zoning status of land and water areas buildings and other structures within the city limits however the legal description of all zoning ordinances shall be the final legal authority as to the zoning status of land 4 retention of earlier zoning maps all zoning maps or remaining portions thereof which have had official force and effect in the city prior to the effective date of these zoning regulations shall be retained as a public record and as a guide to the zoning status of lands and water under the jurisdiction of the city prior to the adoption of this replacement of official zoning map in the event that the official zoning map becomes damaged destroyed lost or difficult to interpret because of the nature or number of changes and additions or because of deterioration the city council shall act to replace the prior official zoning map the new official zoning map may correct drafting or other errors or omissions in the prior official zoning map but no such correction shall have the effect of amending the original official zoning map or any subsequent amendment thereof the new official zoning map shall be identified by the signature of the mayor of the city of south daytona attested by the city clerk and bear the seal of the city under the following words this is to certify that this official zoning map supersedes and replaces the official zoning map adopted on the ____________  ____________  ____________ day of ____________  by of south daytona florida insert date map was replaced unless the prior official zoning map has been lost or totally destroyed the prior map or any significant parts thereof remaining shall be preserved together with all available records pertaining to its adoption or amendment 6 updating zoning base maps no revision of zoning boundaries is permitted except by ordinance however from timetotime the zoning base map may be updated to reflect new annexations and streets and subdivisions formally approved by the city council without further official action by that body rules for interpretation of district boundaries a interpretation of district boundaries where uncertainty exists as to the boundaries of districts as shown on the official zoning map the following rules shall apply 1 boundaries approximately following streets highways alleys or rightsofway boundaries indicated as approximately following the centerlines of streets highways alleys or rightsofway shall be construed to follow such centerlines in the event a rightofway is vacated the district boundary shall be construed as remaining in its location except when ownership of the vacated street is divided other than at the center in which case the boundary shall be construed as moving with the ownership 2 boundaries approximately following platted lot lines boundaries indicated as approximately following platted lot lines shall be construed as following such lot lines 3 boundaries approximately following city limits boundaries indicated as approximately following city limits shall be construed as following such city limits 4 boundaries approximately following railroad lines boundaries indicated as following railroad lines shall be construed to be midway between the main tracks 5 boundaries approximately following bulkhead lines shore lines streams or other water bodies boundaries indicated as following bulkhead or shore lines shall be construed to follow such bulkhead lines or shore lines and in the event of change the bulkhead line or shore line shall be construed as moving with the newly established bulkhead line or the actual shore line  boundaries indicated as approximately following the centerlines of streams rivers canals lakes or other bodies of water shall be construed to follow such centerlines 6 boundaries indicated as entering any body of water boundaries that are indicated as entering any body of water but not continuing to intersect with other zoning boundaries shall be construed as extending in the direction in which they enter the body of water to intersect with other zoning districts 7 boundaries approximately parallel to or extensions of above features boundaries indicated as parallel to or extensions of features shall be so construed distances not specifically indicated on the official zoning map shall be determined by the scale of the map 8 district boundary dividing a lot where a district boundary divides a lot of record at the time the boundary was established and where the division makes impractical the reasonable use of the lot the extension of the regulations for either portion of the lot may be permitted not to exceed 50 feet beyond the district line into the remaining portion of the lot b community development director cdd to interpret boundaries in cases of discrepancy between actual features and zoning map where discrepancies exist between natural or manmade features existing on the ground and those not shown on the official zoning map or in other circumstances not covered by sections above the cdd shall interpret the district boundaries application of district regulations a zoning affects all land buildings and structures no building structure or land shall hereafter be used or occupied and no building or structure or part thereof shall hereafter be erected constructed reconstructed moved or structurally altered except in conformity with the regulations herein specified for the district in which it is located or as otherwise provided for in this article or the nonconforming provisions of the city buildings shall conform to code requirements no building or other structure shall hereafter be erected or altered except for repair work on nonconforming structures 1 to exceed the height bulk or floor area 2 to provide a greater number of dwelling units 3 to occupy a greater percentage of lot area 4 to have narrower or smaller rear yards front yards or side yards 5 to provide less lot area per dwelling unit or to occupy a smaller lot or 6 provide a lesser separation between buildings or portion of buildings than therein required or in any manner contrary to the provisions of this multiple use of required space prohibited no part of a yard or other open space or offstreet parking or loading space required about or in connection with any building for the purpose of complying with this be included as part of a yard open space or offstreet parking or loading space similarly required for any other building except as specifically provided for in this reduction of lot area prohibited no yard or lot existing at the time of passage of this be reduced in dimension or area below the minimum requirements set forth herein for the district in which it is located yards or lots created after the effective date of this meet the minimum requirements established by this uses not permitted by right uses not designated as permitted by right allowed by special exception or as a special use or accessory to these uses shall be prohibited from that district except for special event permit uses elsewhere provided for in this a question arises as to the interpretation of any permitted uses such interpretation shall be made by the city manager andor administrative official or at his request by the city council directly f effect on previously approved and existing developments any site plan or subdivision approved by the city prior to the effective date of this be developed under the dimensional requirements in effect at the time of approval however if construction of such a development does not commence within the time period specified by the city the administrative official shall review the final site plans and may require conformance with any or all current development standards schedule of zoning district regulations a development in all r3 areas a minimum project size the minimum project size shall be one acre however on existing lots of record designated by the comprehensive plan as suitable for multiplefamily development projects on smaller sites may be approved b project density the maximum number of dwelling units shall not exceed ten units per gross acre c project perimeter setbacks front rear and side setbacks shall be designed so that no building is located closer than 25 feet from a public rightofway setbacks from interior property lines shall be equal to or greater than the height of the tallest building in the development but in no case shall be less than 20 feet d building spacing requirements fifty feet between any combination of fronts or rears of adjacent buildings twentyfive feet between any other combination of principal buildings e maximum building height the maximum building height shall be 35 feet f location of parking areas no parking or drives shall be located in the first 20 feet of the required front yard except for direct access drives yard driveways or parking areas may be permitted in the side or rear yards but may not be within ten feet of a property line or any building g sidewalks sidewalks shall be constructed along all public streets 6 open space and landscaping at least 40 percent of the project site shall be retained as open space open space does not include any land area devoted to buildings sidewalks interior streets parking areas or access drives all open space areas shall be landscaped in accordance with the citys landscape ordinance 7 development plan review prior to the issuance of a building permit a site plan approval shall be obtained according to the provisions of of this mhp  mobile home park residential district 1 purpose each mobile home space shall be a minimum of 4000 square feet and shall be at least 40 feet in width the minimum yards required between mobile homes including accessory structures shall be eight feet for the front yard and five feet for side and rear yards b access roads access roads within a mobile home park shall be paved to a width of not less than 20 feet in a common access area of at least 40 feet all access roads will be paved in accordance with city specifications sidewalks not less than four feet in width shall be provided along all access roads all access roads and walkways shall be lighted with an average illumination of at least 03 foot candles c parking the required parking for each unit shall be located on the same lot as that unit where common facilities are provided additional parking shall be required in accordance with this utilities all dwellings and public buildings shall be served by municipal water and sewer systems 7 development plan review prior to the of 50 feet if the front yard is not designed or used for loadingunloading o pud  planned unit development district 1 purpose and intent the purpose and intent of the planned unit development pud district is to promote efficient land use a range of housing types and housing costs usable open space areas the preservation of natural resources and ecologically important areas from destruction innovative site planning concepts and orderly and economical development the pud also allows for a judicious combination of residential and nonresidential uses 2 unified ownership all land within the pud shall be under the ownership of the applicant at the time of rezoning whether that applicant be an individual partnership or corporation or groups of individuals partnerships or corporations pud applicants shall present firm evidence at the time of application of unified ownership of the entire area within the proposed pud 3 permitted uses in general the pud district is intended to accommodate the following uses  however specific uses permitted shall be defined in the master development agreement apartments multiplefamily dwellings townhouses garden apartments parks playgrounds and other recreation facilities to serve the residents of the project singlefamily dwellings twofamily dwellings other uses as permitted in the development agreement 4 accessory uses uses customarily associated with dependent on and incidental to approved principal uses 5 minimum parcel size minimum size for rezoning to pud shall be three acres except for highdensity range 4 areas designated on future land use map a lesser minimum area may be approved if the city council determines that the intent and purpose of these pud regulations and expressed municipal development policy can be served in the particular case 6 maximum density the maximum number of dwelling units allowed in the pud shall be the gross number of units per acre allowed by the underlying future land use map designation plus 50 percent with the exception that puds which provide for an adultonly community age restrictions shall be allowed 50 percent of the underlying land use designation or 20 units per acre whichever is greater an adultonly community is defined as a multifamily development that requires residents to be the age of 55 years or older it shall be permissible for the husband or wife to be less than 55 provided that the spouse is 55 or older the age restrictions must be contained in recorded restrictive covenant that runs with the land and which is enforceable by the city or other form of restriction acceptable to and enforceable by the city the maximum number of dwelling units allowed shall be specified in the master development agreement as approved by the city council 7 minimum lot area and yard requirements lot area and yard requirements shall be determined as part of the development review process and set forth in the master development agreement yards abutting the pud boundary shall not be less than the yard requirements of the zoning district most similar to that portion of the pud the city council may require greater peripheral yards when it is determined that the proposed use may have adverse effects upon adjoining properties or prejudice development thereon 8 maximum building height the maximum building height for a specific project shall be determined as part of the development review process and set forth in the master development agreement as approved by the city council 9 open space and common facilities requirements at least 30 percent of the project area shall be open space a minimum of 20 percent of the project area shall be designated for use as common open space or common facilities no area shall be accepted as common open space unless it meets the following standards a common open space shall be dedicated to and usable by all residents of the planned unit development or specific phase thereof b common open space must be developed for aesthetic amenity or recreational purposes c the location shape size and character of common open space must be shown on the plan d common open space must be suitably improved for its intended use common open space containing natural features worthy of preservation may be left unimproved e common open space shall not include any structures other than recreational or incidental maintenance buildings f appropriate arrangements acceptable to the city shall be made to guarantee the continued maintenance of common open space establishment of trust funds or the creation of a homeowners association 10 underground utilities all utilities within a pud including telephone television cables and electrical systems shall be installed underground appurtenances to these systems and primary facilities which customarily require above ground installation may be exempted 11 supplemental standards for highdensity residential development note that for purposes of this paragraph highdensity residential development is defined as a density of more than ten units per gross acre a primary use multifamily residential development b minimum land area for a project three acres c minimum principal building setbacks inclusive but not in reduction of any required bufferyard 1 front yard thirty feet 2 waterfront yard sixty feet from the bulkhead line however where the site abuts an r1a underresidentialfloors parking is provided whichever is lower 3 multifamily with a density of more than ten units per gross acre but less than 25 units per gross acre the maximum height shall be 50 feet exclusive of chimneys parapets or cupulas the maximum height shall be measured from finished grade 4 multifamily with a density of 25 units or more per gross acre the maximum height shall be 120 feet exclusive of lowerlevel underresidentialportionofbuilding parking  except that additional building height may be approved by the city council on a casebycase basis according to the following formula an additional ten feet of height may be granted for each additional ten feet of setback beyond the minimum required  if the project abuts an r1a residential zone the additional setback must at least be provided up against that residential zone  the additional height may be provided anywhere on the building or buildings however in no case may the maximum building height exceed 185 feet nonhabitable accessory decorative or service features 5 multifamily with a height greater than 50 feet must be located on parcels with halifax river frontage g density bonus 1 multifamily in the divided by 70 ie  the reciprocal of the ratio does not apply which equates to a maximum difference between the two frontages of 30 percent for example a site with 100 lineal feet of roadway frontage
