minimizes the adverse impacts on the beneficial functions of the affected environmentally sensitive zone a design standards  the development shall be designed to a allow the movement of aquatic life requiring shallow water  b maintain existing flood channel capacity  c assure stable shoreline embankments  development that encroaches on the shoreline protection zone shall be located other than a on unstable shorelines where water depths are inadequate to eliminate or minimize the need for offshore or foreshore channel construction dredging maintenance dredging spoil disposal filling beach feeding and other river lake and channel maintenance activities  b in areas where there is inadequate water mixing and flushing  c in areas which have been identified as hazardous due to high winds or flooding  nondeveloped portions of the shoreline protection zone that are damaged during construction shall be restored or replaced of vegetation restocking of fish shellfish and wildlife reestablishment of drainage patterns and the like  accessory uses must be water dependent or necessary for the operation of the development and must be consistent in scale and intensity with the surrounding uses fill shall not be placed in waters or associated wetlands to create usable land space for accessory uses  catwalks docks and other structures located over water surfaces shall not obstruct more than 20 percent of the total width of the waterway or canal at normal high water elevation  51199 undergrounding of electric cable and telephone lines a the general policy of the city is to require underground installation of electric cable and telephone lines utilities to the greatest extent feasible in order to assure public safety foster tree preservation and protect the general aesthetic character of the city b except as provided herein all utility lines and services with the exception of temporary construction lines shall be installed underground at the owners developers or builders expense this policy shall specifically apply to all cables conduits or wires forming part of an electrical distribution system including service lines to individual properties necessary to serve new development or existing development where new or upgraded service is being installed underground installation shall not be required for 1 electric transmission lines those lines that transmit electricity between generating stations and substations 2 electric feeder lines those lines that transmit electricity between substations and individual subdivisions and projects the installation of new feeder lines will be coordinated between the city and the utility company 3 appurtenances such as transformers pedestalmounted terminal boxes and meter cabinets when placed on a level concrete slab and located so as to minimize noise effects on surrounding properties 4 lines serving interim land uses such as agricultural use of land designated for future urban development 5 replacement of existing overhead service lines where no other site improvements are required due to expansion or change of use 6 replacement of lines on existing poles 7 service to individual residential lots in developed areas of the city presently served by overhead utility lines c waiver of underground installation requirement underground installation that would be required above may be waived as part of final site plan or subdivision approval when established existing and extraordinary physical conditions and distances service demands or other site planning requirements result in economic impact or other circumstances that justify relief from this requirement such waiver is conditioned on the following 1 the proposed overhead route does not contain trees of over 12 inches in diameter 2 the proposed overhead route is not within and parallel to an existing or future required buffer between differing land uses and does not conflict with required tree preservation or landscape installations 3 the proposed overhead route is designed so as to minimize its visibility from offsite public areas 4 overhead routes along arterial or collector roads shall be discouraged however if such a route is required poles shall be located so as to accommodate necessary street lighting 5 due to the unique characteristics of electric power distribution waivers for overhead power shall not automatically allow the installation of other utility lines parallel requests for such waivers shall be considered separately 6 the cost differential between underground installation and overhead installation shall not be considered as the sole reason for waiver or installation 7 all waivers shall be conditioned upon payment to the city of a negotiated sum of money with the main factor in determining the sum of money to be paid being the estimated cost of undergrounding all payments received by the city shall be deposited into a separate fund to be used for undergrounding projects in the city d approval of overhead line and service routes waivers may be requested as part of the application for final subdivision or site plan approval or building permit the following information shall be submitted as part of the application 1 a letter requesting the waiver providing written justification for the granting of a waiver including documentation from utility companies contractors or engineers to verify cost estimates or service demands 2 a map or engineering drawing showing the route of the proposed lines and existing or proposed easements covering the route 3 a survey or drawing showing trees that must be removed or substantially pruned to allow the proposed construction 4 drawings showing the relationship of the proposed line to existing and proposed lots buildings landscaping streets and other improvements this may be reflected in typical details where appropriate 5 a drawing showing the construction detail of proposed lines and poles including dimensions and materials  52306 water conservation for landscape irrigation a intent and purpose it is the intent and purpose of the ordinance from which this section derives to implement procedures that promote water conservation efficient landscape irrigation b definitions 1 for the purpose of this section the following terms phrases words and their derivatives shall have the meaning given herein when not inconsistent with the context words used in the present tense include the future words in the plural include the singular and words in the singular include the plural a address means the house number of a physical location of a specific property this includes rural route numbers but excludes post office box numbers if a lot number in a mobile home park or similar community is used by the us postal service to determine a delivery location the lot number shall be the propertys address an even numbered address means an address ending in the numbers 0 2 4 6 8 or the letters am an odd numbered address means an address ending in the numbers 1 3 5 7 9 or the letters nz b district means the st johns river water management district c person means any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind d landscape irrigation means the outside watering of plants in a landscape such as shrubbery trees lawns grass ground covers plants vines gardens and other such flora that are situated in such diverse locations as residential areas public commercial and industrial establishments and public medians and rightsofway landscape irrigation does not include agricultural crops nursery plants cemeteries golf course greens tees fairways primary roughs and vegetation associated with recreational areas such as playgrounds football baseball and soccer fields e residential landscape irrigation means the irrigation of landscape associated with any housing unit having sanitary and kitchen facilities designed to accommodate one or more residents including multiple housing units and mobile homes f nonresidential landscape irrigation means the irrigation of landscape not included within the definition of residential landscape irrigation such as that associated with public commercial and industrial property including commercial or transient housing units hotel and motel units and public medians and rightsofway c landscape irrigation schedules 1 when daylight savings time is in effect landscape irrigation shall occur only in accordance with the following irrigation schedule a residential landscape irrigation at odd numbered addresses or no address may occur only on wednesday and saturday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and b residential landscape irrigation at even numbered addresses may occur only on thursday and sunday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and c nonresidential landscape irrigation may occur only on tuesday and friday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and d no more than 34 inch of water may be applied per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs and in no event shall irrigation occur for more than one hour per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs 2 when eastern standard time is in effect landscape irrigation shall occur only in accordance with the following irrigation schedule a residential landscape irrigation at odd numbered addresses or no address may occur only on saturday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and b residential landscape irrigation at even numbered addresses may occur only on sunday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and c nonresidential landscape irrigation may occur only on tuesday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and d no more than 34 inch of water may be applied per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs and in no event shall irrigation occur for more than one hour per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs 3 all landscape irrigation shall be limited in amount to only what is necessary to meet landscape needs d exceptions to the landscape irrigation schedules landscape irrigation shall be subject to the following irrigation schedule exceptions 1 irrigation using a microspray microjet drip or bubbler irrigation system is allowed anytime 2 irrigation of new landscape is allowed at any time of day on any day for the initial 30 days and every other day for the next 30 days for a total of one 60day period provided that the irrigation is limited to the minimum amount necessary for such landscape establishment 3 watering in of chemicals including insecticides pesticides fertilizers fungicides and herbicides when required by law the manufacturer or best management practices is allowed at any time of day on any day within 24 hours of application watering in of chemicals shall not exceed 14 inch of water per application except as otherwise required by law the manufacturer or best management practices 4 irrigation systems may be operated at any time of day on any day for maintenance and repair purposes not to exceed 20 minutes per hour per zone 5 irrigation using a handheld hose equipped with an automatic shutoff nozzle is allowed at any time of day on any day 6 discharge of water from a watertoair airconditioning unit or other waterdependent cooling system is not limited 7 the use of water from a reclaimed water system is allowed anytime for the purpose of this paragraph a reclaimed water system includes systems in which the primary source is reclaimed water which may or may not be supplemented from another source during peak demand periods 8 the use of recycled water from wet detention treatment ponds for irrigation is allowed anytime provided the ponds are not augmented from any ground or offsite surface water or public supply sources e additional requirement any person who purchases and installs an automatic landscape irrigation system must properly install maintain and operate technology that inhibits or interrupts operation of the system during periods of sufficient moisture f variance from specific day of the week limitations a variance from the specific landscape irrigation days or day set forth in may be granted if strict application of the scheduled days or day would lead to unreasonable or unfair results in particular instances provided that the applicant demonstrates with particularity that compliance with the scheduled days or day will result in a substantial economic health or other hardship on the applicant requesting the variance or those served by the applicant where a contiguous property is divided into different zones a variance may be granted hereunder so that each zone may be irrigated on different days or day than other zones of the property however in no event shall a variance allow a single zone to be irrigated more than two days per week during daylight savings time or more than one day per week during eastern standard time g application of this section the provisions of this section shall apply to each person located within the city of south daytona h enforcement officials law enforcement officials having jurisdiction in the area governed by this section are hereby authorized to enforce the provisions of this section in addition the city manager may also delegate enforcement responsibility for this section to agencies and the city i penalties violation of any provision of this section shall be subject to the following penalties first violation written warning second violation $5000 subsequent violations fine not to exceed $50000 each day in violation of this section shall constitute a separate offense enforcement officials shall provide violators with no more than one written warning in addition to the civil sanctions contained herein the city of south daytona may take any other appropriate legal action including but not limited to injunctive action to enforce the provisions of this section  1 11816 article viii  general design standards landscape provisions a purpose and intent the purpose and intent of the city of south daytona landscape regulations is to recapture and maintain many of the environmental features and amenities of the city for present and future generations adherence to this article will improve the appearance of offstreet vehicular use areas vua and commercial properties within the city installation and maintenance of landscaping for screening and aesthetic effects thereby serving to protect and preserve the appearance character value and safety of the community and providing for the general welfare in addition the intent of this chapter is to provide for additional and adequate offstreet drainage it is intended that these provisions shall constitute minimum requirements  more stringent standards will be allowed b applicable areas all vehicular use areas except those located on under or within buildings and except those serving one and twofamily residential uses shall conform to the minimum landscaping requirements hereinafter provided  commercial properties are also covered by these requirements vehicular use areas shall include all areas used for parking circulation andor display of any and all types of vehicles boats or heavy construction equipment or other machinery capable of movements over streets and highways whether selfpropelled or not and all areas upon which such vehicles traverse as a function of the primary uses of the related structures or properties these regulations shall apply to activities of a drivein nature such as a service station convenience store bank restaurant multiple dwellings etc the requirements set forth herein shall also apply to additions to existing vuas and commercial properties if the landscape area falls within the bounds of the applicable streetscape areas streetscape provisions shall also apply c landscape permit requirements prior to the development or expansion of any vehicular use area or commercial property application shall be made to the community development department for the approval of a site plan pursuant to approval shall be issued by the community development department after review and determination by the development review committee that the plan meets the requirements of this landscape standards the development of vuas and commercial properties shall conform to the following standards 1 landscaping shall consist of any of the following or combination thereof materials such as but not limited to grafts ground covers shrubs bushes hedges flowering plants vines small trees trees or palms in addition nonliving durable materials may be used to complement landscaping but not to be credited as such these materials include but are not limited to rocks pebbles wood chips wood structures walls fences and mulch but not paving and sand 2 plant materials used in conformance with the provisions of this article shall conform to the standard for florida no 1 or better as listed in the latest edition of grades and standards for nursery plants state of florida department of agriculture tallahassee florida or equivalent except where in the discretion of the city manager or his designee natural vegetation is adequate to provide the necessary visual screening a trees shall be of a species recognized by the state of florida division of forestry as being acceptable for this area the number of different species of trees required shall be as follows required number of trees minimum number of species 110 2 1115 3 1620 4 2125 5 2630 6 over 30 7 trees shall be a species achieving at maturity an average crown spread of greater than 15 feet and having trunks which can be maintained with a minimum of six feet of clear wood trunk between finished grade and the lowest branch trees having an average mature crown of less than 15 feet may be substituted by grouping these trees to create the equivalent of a 15foot crown spread to encourage greenery trees planted in excess of the minimum number required shall be exempt from the minimum crown spread shade tree species shall have a minimum diameter of 30 inches measured 6 inches above ground and shall be a minimum of 12 feet high at the time of planting where shade trees are planted in a row they shall be planted at intervals no greater than 40 feet apart oncenter understory trees shall have a minimum diameter of 25 inches measured six inches above ground and shall be a minimum of eight feet high at the time of planting where shade trees are specified but cannot be used due to site limitations understory trees may be substituted at the ratio of two understory trees for every shade tree where understory trees are specified but the applicant desires to use ornamentals trees ornamental trees may be substituted at the ratio of two ornamental trees per understory tree where multitrunk trees are specified such as crepe myrtles or lagustrums they must be a minimum of five trunks each trunk having a minimum diameter of threequarters inches the minimum height of such a tree shall be eight feet where city staff determines that it is appropriate at the request of the applicant certain palms such as cabbage palms or washingtonian palms may be substituted for specified shade trees at the ratio of three palms for each shade tree however no more than 25 percent of the total number of specified trees may be such palms except for highvalue palms palm trees will not be eligible for city grant assistance certain palms such as canary island pindo and majool may due to their elegance and high value be substituted for specified shade trees on a treefortree basis however the use of eucalyptus camaldulensis australian pine casuarina equisetifolia punk melaleuca leucadendra and brazilian pepper schinus terebinthifolius shall be prohibited under this section b shrubs and hedges shrubs including hedges shall be a minimum of two and onehalf feet in height at the time of planting and they must be a minimum threegallon size shrubs must be planted at a distance not to exceed three feet on center hedges where required shall be planted and maintained so as to form a continuous unbroken solid visual screen within a maximum of one year after time of planting hedge plants are to be planted at distances no greater than 30 inches on center c ground cover ground cover of plant materials that reach an average height of not more than 18 inches may be used in lieu of grass in whole or in part these plants shall be a minimum onegallon size with a spacing that varies according to species but is never more than 36 inches on center they shall be planted in such a manner so as to present a finished appearance with reasonably complete coverage d lawn grass grass areas shall be planted and may be sodded plugged sprigged or seeded with native species solid sod shall be used in swales or other areas subject to erosion and providing that in areas where other than solid sod or grass seed is used nurse grass seed shall be sown for immediate effect and protection until coverage is achieved when sodding is used in any landscape application in the city it shall be placed so as to provide a continuous and smooth contour e installation and maintenance all landscaping shall be installed in a sound workmanshiplike manner and according to accepted good planting procedures all trees and palms must be properly staked at time of installation the landscaping shall be installed so as to meet all applicable ordinances and code requirements the owner shall be responsible for the maintenance of all landscaping which shall be maintained in good condition so as to present a healthy neat and orderly appearance and shall be kept free from weeds refuse and debris any installation which was made prior to the adoption of this in conformance with an approved site plan shall be maintained in conformance with this landscaped areas shall be provided with an automatic underground irrigation system equipped with a rain sensor adequate to service the landscaped areas in the event that trees shrubs or other landscaped materials die such materials shall be replaced within 30 days in case of a natural disaster which destroys over 50 percent of the trees on the affected properties the property owner shall have six months to replace the trees as required by this of the owner of the property to maintain the premises in good condition as set forth above shall make the owner liable for the penalties as set forth in no landscaped area may be abandoned paved or otherwise employed without applying for and obtaining an amendment to an approved site plan pursuant to this article f landscaping adjacent to public rightofway wherever a vehicular use area will not be entirely screened visually from any abutting rightofway except a dedicated alley there shall be provided landscaping between such vua and rightofway as follows 1 a strip of land at least seven feet in depth located adjacent to the abutting rightofway shall be landscaped per the requirements of a type 1 bufferyard the remainder of the required landscaped areas shall be landscaped with grass ground cover or other acceptable materials excluding paving sand or gravel lands located along streets identified by the city for special treatment shall be planted with street trees in accordance with the provisions found in the south daytona streetscape plan 2 all property other than the required landscape strip lying between the street and vua shall be landscaped with a combination of shrubs ground cover and trees equal to at least 50 percent of the landscape materials requirement 3 necessary accessways from the public rightofway such landscaping shall be permitted to service the vehicular use area and such accessways may be subtracted from the lineal dimension used to determine the number of trees required g perimeter landscaping relating to abutting properties 1 wherever a vua will not be entirely screened visually from abutting property by an intervening building or structure the portion of such vua not so screened shall be provided with a landscape barrier meeting the requirements of a type 1 bufferyard or a more restrictive bufferyard if required by the site use the applicant is encouraged to incorporate earthen mounding curvilinear design and offset placement of requirement plant life any perimeter landscaping strip in excess of ten feet shall incorporate these design standards 2 landscaping shall be provided in accordance with type 1 bufferyard requirements h interior landscaping requirements an area or combination of areas equal to a minimum of ten percent of the total square footage of the vua shall be devoted to landscaping and may be counted as part of the interior landscaping requirement when the vua is adjacent to a structure or structures on the same parcel of land any landscaping on said parcel which serves to beautify the vua may be counted toward meeting the interior landscaping requirements such landscaped areas shall be located in such a manner as to divide and break up the monotony of paving or to prevent and discourage erratic vehicular movement a combination of the following interior landscaping elements shall be counted as part of the interior landscaping requirements where applicable 1 landscape islands rows of parking spaces shall be separated every ten spaces and terminated on both ends by landscaped islands which measure an average of not less than ten feet in side width and extend the entire lengthy of the parking spaces at least one tree or grouping shall be planted on said island landscape islands must be bounded by a concrete curb minimum six high 2 all parking rows shall be separated with a minimum landscape area of four feet above and beyond any landscaped vehicular overhang area 3 in vuas where the strict application of this section will seriously limit the function of said area the required landscaping may be located near the perimeter of the paved area including any perimeter which may be adjacent to a building on the site this required interior landscaping shall be in addition to the required perimeter landscaping 4 parking spaces shall be designed use of wheel stops curbing or raised sidewalks to prevent the encroachment of vehicles upon or into landscaped areas and encourage runoff to the landscaped area only encroachment is defined as any protrusion of a vehicle outside of a parking space display area or accessway into a landscaped area 5 all landscaping within a 15foot radius of a fire hydrant shall consist of grass or ground cover which does not exceed 12 inches in height when a fire hydrant is located in a terminal island special treatment should be given to the placement of required plant material i unobstructed visibility at intersections when an accessway intersects a public rightofway or when the subject property abuts the intersection of two or more public rightsofway all landscaping within the triangle areas described below shall provide unobstructed cross visibility at a level between three feet and seven feet with the following proviso that trees or palms shall have limbs and foliage trimmed in such a manner that no limbs or foliage extend into the crossvisibility area the triangle areas referred to above are 1 the triangle areas within the property on both sides of the accessway formed by the intersection of each side of the accessway and the public rightofway line with two sides of each triangle being ten feet in length from the point of intersection and the third side being a line connecting the ends of the other two sides 2 the area of property located at the corner formed by the intersection of two or more public rightsofway with two sides of the triangular area being 30 feet in length along the abutting public rightofway lines or projections thereof measured from their point of intersection and the third side being a line connecting the ends of the other two lines and including all surfaced portions of the public rightofway adjacent thereto j existing plant material if the owners can demonstrate that healthy plant material exists on a site prior to its development for the purposes of offstreet parking or other vehicular use areas the application of the above landscape standards may be adjusted to allow credit for such plant material if such an adjustment is in keeping with the intent of this section k stormwater management all vuas shall provide for adequate management of stormwater in accordance with the requirements of this they must be shown on all development plans areas required for landscaping may be used for stormwater management as long as the landscaping purposes of this section are not impeded l xeriscape the use of xeriscape principles shall be allowed particularly as a means of water conservation m south daytona streetscape guidelines in order to improve the citys appearance environment and community welfare the city hereby adopts by reference the document entitled streetscape guidelines april 1989 those guidelines set forth concepts for planting of street trees along major roadway segments and other areas of the city all proposed development falling within those described areas shall be reviewed in light of those guidelines as a supplement to the other landscape requirements found herein n city inspection prior to installation of landscaping proposed landscaping project sites shall be inspected by the city prior to installation of the landscaping the landscape installer shall submit a timely request for such an inspection to the community development department prior to installation o city acceptance of landscaping projects the community development director or his designee shall be responsible for acceptance of landscaping projects after they are completed prior to acceptance the following actions are required 1 a qualified city employee or contracted party shall inspect the landscaping to ensure that it meets city standards 2 an asbuilt drawing of the landscaping shall be submitted to the community development department containing notes to the effect that the plants meet the florida #1 standard and that the installation meets the sound workmanship requirement  72302 sign regulations a statement of purpose the purpose of this section is to create regulations for the design construction and location of signs to protect the public safety and welfare  to preserve the unique planned character and the natural and scenic environment of the city  to provide ample opportunity for business advertisement while preventing excessive dangerous and unsightly signs  to prevent clutter among sign displays which would distract vehicle operators or place excessive demands on public attention and have a detrimental effect on the character and appearance of the residential commercial and industrial areas of the city  to provide for adequate maintenance and inspection  and to reasonably assist potential customers in locating and identifying services facilities and products offered within the city b applicability this section is intended to cover all requirements relative to the types sizes heights verbal content permissible locations restrictions permits and licenses inspections identification materials of manufacture andor construction methods of erection and maintenance for all signs placed installed repaired altered replaced andor erected within the city limits which are exposed to the outofdoors view of the public c definitions 1 sign means any device or display including that portion of the supporting structure for freestanding or roof signs which consists of braces uprights or poles projecting from the ground or buildings etc and which is primarily designed to provide sign support comprised of letters numbers symbols picturesillustrations announcements cutouts insignia trade marks or demonstrations including all trim and borders designed to advertise inform identify or attract the attention of persons not on the display premises a sign shall be constructed to be a single display surface device or unit containing elements organized related and composed to form a single sign unit the term sign means every billboard ground sign pole sign elevated sign marquee sign mansard sign awning sign canopy sign projecting sign wall sign roof sign illuminated sign street clock real estate sign or any other sign and includes any announcement declaration demonstration display illustration or insignia used to advertise or promote any particular interest when the sign is placed out of doors where is can be viewed by the public 2 abandoned or obsolete sign means a sign which for 180 consecutive calendar days no longer advertises a bona fide and active business conducted or product sold 3 animated sign means a sign upon which a character letter or figure or group or combination thereof show movement or motion to such an extent as to be readily detected 4 awning sign means a sign affixed to or part of a temporary shelter supported entirely from the exterior wall of a building and composed of nonrigid materials except for the supporting framework 5 banner sign means a sign possessing characters letters illustrations or ornamentations applied to cloth paper or fabric of any kind either with or without frames 6 bench sign means any sign attached to or painted upon any bench or other device located upon public property and utilized for the seating of persons 7 billboard means an outdoor ground sign elevated ground sign roof sign or wall sign upon which advertising matter may be painted or upon which posters may be pasted or otherwise secured on the face thereof advertising goods services or other things not sold or available upon the premises upon which the sign is located 8 canopy sign means any permanent sign attached to or constructed in or on a canopy 9 changeable copy sign means a sign on which copy is changed manually in the field  ie reader boards with changeable letters or pictorial panels 10 changing sign means a sign such as an electronically controlled public service time temperature and date sign or message center where different copy changes are shows in the same lamp bank 11 construction sign means a sign placed on property where construction is in progress and because construction is in progress  it may include the names of persons and firms performing services or supplying labor or materials to the premises 12 copy area means the same thing as the term sign area see definition in this section 13 directional signage means signs used solely for the purpose of controlling onsite traffic flow all signage shall meet design standardseg for size height color type face material and locationpresently used by the florida department of transportation as defined in the manual of uniform traffic control devices of the federal highway administration 14 directory sign means a sign giving the name andor occupation of a building  or gives the use of the building including office building directories church directories and apartment house directories a directory sign shall be a wall or ground sign 15 erect means to attach alter build construct reconstruct enlarge or move and shall include the painting of wall signs but does not include copy changes on any sign 16 facing or surface means the surface of the sign upon against or the message is displayed or illustrated on the sign 17 flashing sign means a sign or any part thereof which contains an intermittent or flashing light source or which includes the illusion of intermittent or flashing lights by means of animation or an externally mounted intermittent light source automatic changing signs such as public service time temperature and date signs or electronically controlled message centers are not classed as flashing signs 18 freestanding sign means a ground or pole sign as defined in this section 19 ground sign means a freestanding outdoor advertising display sign which meets the following requirementseither rests upon the ground or is supported on the ground with an air space not exceeding two feet between the ground and the underside of the sign  has a maximum height of eight feet above the ground the term ground sign does not include the term pole sign 20 lighted sign means any sign which has characters letters figures designs or outline illuminated by electric lights or luminous tubes as a part of the sign proper 21 marquee sign means a sign attached to or hung from a marquee  and marquee means a canopy or covered structure projecting from and supported by a building when such canopy or covered structure extends beyond the building line or property line 22 mural means a picture painted directly upon or permanently affixed to an exterior wall whether residential or nonresidential  any such mural is deemed to be a sign 23 nonconforming signs means signs which are in violation of any part of this the effective date of this amendment thereto 24 other advertising structure means any marquee canopy awning or street clock as further defined herein 25 parked vehicle used as advertising sign means a vehicle parked in a specific location for more than 24 hours which is clearly visible from public rightofway and which has attached thereto or located thereon any sign or advertising device in excess of six square feet of sign area for the apparent purpose of providing advertisement of products or directing people to a business or business activity 26 pennants means pieces of cloth paper or fabric of any kind attached to a rope string or cable and designed to create motion when attached to a sign or structure 27 pole sign means a freestanding outdoor advertising display sign which is supported above the ground by means of a pole or poles or similar support projecting from the ground and not attached to any building  such a sign must have an air space between the underside of the sign and the ground of at least eight feet the term pole sign does not include the term ground sign 28 portable electrical sign means a temporary electrical outdoor advertising display sign used in addition to regular business signs to advertise special events 29 professional sign means a sign designating the office of a doctor dentist lawyer accountant or other practicing professional 30 prohibited signs means signs which are not allowed by the provisions of this projecting sign means an outdoor advertising display sign which is affixed to any building wall or structure and extends beyond the building wall structure building line or property line 32 real estate sign means any structure device display board screen surface or wall with characters letters or illustrations placed thereto or thereon where the matter displayed is solely for the purpose of offering real estate for sale or lease 33 replacing means rebuilding enlarging or changing the size structure lettering or sign copy other than repainting or repair to electrical or mechanical apparatus 34 roof sign means any sign erected constructed or maintained upon against or directly above a roof or on top of or above the parapet of a building in accordance with the standard building a sign located on a roof with a slope of 45 degree or less 35 sandwich sign means any double or singlefaced sign which is portable and may readily be moved from place to place 36 shingle sign means a wall sign not over 216 square inches in area attached securely to a building to identify the nature of the business located within 37 shopping center means a group of commercial establishments primarily retail which are planned developed owned or managed as a unit 38 shopping center sign means an exterior sign located in a shopping center 39 sign area means the surface area in square feet within any geometric figure or combination of figures encompassing all parts of a sign including the outer extremities of all letters figures characters background frame trim molding and decorative features but excluding structural supports whether they be columns pylons or a building or part thereof unless the sign is affixed directly on the exterior surface of such structure a projecting or ground sign with sign surface on both sides shall be considered a single sign and the total area of such a sign shall be the area computed on a single face a projecting or ground sign that is in a vee shape shall be computed as a single face sign provided that the separation between the faces does not exceed three feet 40 sign rider means a small sign which is temporarily attached to the perimeter of a larger real estate sign 41 sign unit means any display or display device containing elements organized related or composed to convey an integrated message where the display of any elements is in a random manner without any organized relationship of elements each element shall be considered a separate sign 42 snipe sign means a sign of any material including paper cardboard wood and metal when tacked nailed or attached in any way to trees telephone poles power poles street signs or other objects where such sign may or may not apply to the premises this definition includes cardboard signs on sticks 43 spectacular sign means an outdoor advertising display sign with copy usually animated constructed of metal wired for lights or luminous tubing or both with copy action control by the flasher circuit breakers or matographs and attached on an open face metal structure built especially for the purpose 44 subdivision sign means a sign designed as apartment structure to identify a subdivision  such a sign shall not be used for development or promotional purposes and shall only bear the name of the subdivision 45 temporary sign means a sign which may be used only for a relatively short period of time and which typically consists of a banner pennant valance or advertising display constructed of cloth canvas light fabric paper cardboard wallboard or other light materials with or without frames 46 under canopy sign means a sign suspended below the ceiling of a canopy 47 wall sign means an outdoor advertising display sign that is affixed to the side of any building or wall 48 window sign means any sign installed on the inside of a window whether attached to the window or not for purposes of viewing from outside the premises d permits required any person wishing to construct erect alter move or post a sign in the city of south daytona shall first secure a permit after submitting plans and specifications to the community development department hereinafter known as the department an application form provided by the department shall require the applicant to include the following information size type structure heights proximity to building rightsofway streets and general location 1 work which may be performed by a property owner or lessee a painting the face of any freestanding or wall sign  b installation or attachment of any individual letters which does not require electrical service or structural modification of the surface or wall to which such letters are being attached 2 other work shall be performed by a sign contractor general contractor or building contractor licensed with the city to perform such work a construction installation erection or electrical connection of any sign which is internally illuminated  b construction installation or erection of any new sign being installed under the provisions of this section 3 application all applications filed by either the owner lessee or contractor shall include a name address and telephone number of owners of property  b name address and telephone number of licensed sign company erecting the sign  c street address or legal description of the property upon which the sign is to be located  d the height size shape style colors materials and location of the sign  e written permission of the owner his lessee or agent to erect the sign  f a plan sketch blueprint or similar presentation drawn to scale showing all pertinent structural and electrical details wind pressure requirements and materials in accordance with the citys adopted building code the city reserves the right to require plan certification by a licensed registered engineer if deemed necessary by the chief building official  and g a statement verifying the height size shape and location of existing signage on the premises 4 issuance of permit upon receipt of an application for a sign permit the department shall review the plans specifications and other data relating to such sign and if considered necessary inspect the premises upon which the sign is proposed to be erected if the proposed sign is in compliance with this section and all other applicable laws and codes of the city a sign permit shall be issued upon receipt of the permit fee 5 permit fees permit fees under this section shall be set by resolutions of the city council sign permit fees shall be in accordance with the standard schedule of building permit fees in addition an annual inspection and renewal fee shall be charged for all existing signs within the city  it will be added to the annual local business tax receipt fee of each business 6 permit expiration the requirements are the same as for a standard building permit ie the permit expires after six months from date of issuance unless the work has begun  even after the work has begun any sign permit will automatically expire 12 months after date of issuance  all permits expire after work is completed and accepted by the city 7 sign bond the requirement for a sign bond shall be limited to temporary signage and shall only be imposed in cases where city records show that in the past the person responsible for the signage has not removed it in a timely manner when required the amount of this sign bond shall be $15000 which shall be returned to the applicant upon timely removal of the signage e exempt actions and signs exemption from the requirement to obtain a sign permit shall be permitted as follows 1 ordinary maintenance maintenance painting repainting cleaning or other normal maintenance and repair of a sign not involving painting or repainting of copy are or structural or electrical changes of the standard building applies 2 change of copy changing of the advertising copy or message on an existing approved changeable copy sign 3 window displays changes in the content of show window displays within the building 4 instructional signs instructional signs which are located entirely on the property to which they pertain do not advertise a business and do not exceed three square feet in area entrance and exit signs may contain a corporate logo or similar identifying insignia not exceeding one square foot in size 5 governmental signs governmental signs for control of traffic and other regulatory purposes street signs danger signs railroad crossing signs signs of public service companies indicating danger and officially authorized aids to public service or safety 6 interior signs signs located within any building or building complex or within an enclosed lobby or court 7 symbols or insignia religious symbols commemorative plaques of recognized historical agencies or identification emblems of religious orders or historical agencies provided that no such symbol plaque or emblem shall exceed four square feet in area 8 public information signs signs used to provide public information or direction erected by authority of a public body 9 window signs any sign installed on the inside of a window whether attached to the window or not for purposes of viewing from outside the premises except that no such signage may cover more than 50 percent of the area of the window 10 certain special signs the following types of signs no trespassingdumping signs  freestanding memorial signs or tablets and names of building and dates of erection when cut into any masonry surface or when constructed of bronze or other noncombustible materials and attached to the surface of a building  legal notices and official instruments  holiday lights and seasonal decorations  public warning signs  menu signs of less that two square fee mounted at the entrances to restaurants  temporary window signs which are removed in ten days  works off art which do not constitute advertising  no smoking or shut off engine type signs accompanying fuel dispensing pumps at gas stations 11 removal not relocation of a sign f general 1 unsafe and unlawful signs if the chief building official finds that any sign or other advertising structure regulated herein is unsafe or insecure or is a menace to the public or has been constructed or erected or is being maintained in violation of the provisions of this section he shall give written notice of violation to the permittee if the permittee fails to remove or alter the structure so as to comply with the standards herein within ten days after issuance of such notice such sign or other advertising structure may be removed or altered to comply by the chief building official at the expense of the permittee or owner who refuses to issue a permit to any permittee or owner who refuses to pay costs so assessed the chief building official may cause any sign or other advertising structure which is an immediate peril to persons or property to be removed summarily and without notice 2 general safety signs must not create a traffic or fire hazard be dangerous to the general welfare or interfere with the free use of public streets or sidewalks 3 obstruction of ingress or egress no sign shall be attached to or placed against a building in such a manner as to prevent or impede ingress and egress door or window of any building nor shall any sign obstruct or be attached to a fire escape 4 sign maintenance the sign maintenance standard of the city is that all signs must be kept in good repair clean free of rust and flaking paint with unbroken sign faces and functional bulbs  it also means that all signs should be maintained in substantially the same condition as when they were erected  it also means that they shall be kept legible and complete as well as safe and repaired in a timely manner the chief building official shall inspect annually or at such times as he deems necessary each sign or other advertising structure regulated by this the purpose of ascertaining whether it is properly secured and whether it is in need of maintenance repair or removal those signs which he finds to be in need of maintenance repair removal or otherwise not in conformance with applicable regulations will be brought to the attention of the owner the owner or his designated agent shall be required to obtain the necessary permits for either returning the sign to proper condition or removing it 5 removal of abandoned signs any sign now or hereafter existing which for 180 consecutive calendar days no longer advertises a bona fide and active business conducted or a product sold shall immediately upon expiration of the 180day period be deemed abandoned and thereafter within ten days after issuance of written notification from the chief building official it shall be taken down and removed by the owner agent or person having the beneficial use of the building or structure upon which such sign may be found upon failure to comply with such notice within the time specified in the order the chief building official is hereby authorized to cause removal of such sign and any expense incident thereto shall be paid by the owner of the building or structure to which such sign is attached billboards maintained in good condition shall not be subject to removal under this section due to temporary absence of advertising material thereon 6 prohibited signs the following signs are prohibited in the city a those that communicate obscenity or indecency b billboards c snipe signs d flashing signs e signs on or over public lands f projecting signs g parked vehicles used principally as advertising signs h spectacular signs i all signs not specifically permitted or exempted by this signs that contain any lighting or control mechanism that causes unreasonable interference with radio television or other communication signals k searchlights used to advertise or promote a business or to attract customers to a property l signs with visible moving revolving or rotating parts or visible mechanical movement of any description or other apparent visible movement achieved by electrical electronic or mechanical means except for traditional barber poles m signs with lights or illuminations that flash move rotate scintillate blink flicker or vary in intensity or color including electronic message center signs which term includes signs that display timetemperaturedate however existing electronic message center signs in operation within the city prior to  shall be allowed to remain at their current location as a nonconforming structure the existing electronic message center signs shall be programmed to have a minimum display time of five seconds per message and a change time not to exceed two seconds all existing electronic message center signs shall reduce the sign lighting intensity by 50 percent during the hours between  pm and  am daily n strings of light bulbs used on commercially developed parcels for commercial purposes other than traditional holiday decorations o signs that incorporate projected images emit any sound that is intended to attract attention or involve the use of live animals p signs that emit audible sound odor or visible matter such as smoke or steam q signs that obstruct the vision of pedestrians cyclists or motorists traveling on or entering public streets r signs within ten feet of public rightofway or 100 feet of trafficcontrol lights that contain red or green lights that might be confused with traffic control lights s signs that are of such intensity or brilliance as to cause glare or impair the vision of any motorist cyclist or pedestrian using or entering a public way or that are a hazard or a nuisance to occupants of any property because of glare or other characteristics t signs on the interior of store windows to the extent that they exceed 50 percent of the area of the window 7 construction standards a compliance with building all signs shall comply with the appropriate detailed provisions of the municipal construction and electrical codes and the construction standards hereinafter set forth b structural designs  all signs that contain more than 40 square feet in area or are erected over 20 feet in height shall be designed by an engineer registered in the state of florida structural drawings shall be prepared and sealed by the engineer and submitted prior to a permit being issued wind load calculations shall be contained in the engineering drawings c request for wind load calculations  the chief building official may request wind load calculations for signs less than 40 square feet in area prior to issuing a permit d design and strength of walls  a wall must be designed for and have sufficient strength to support any sign which is attached thereto e sign identification and marking  each sign hereinafter erected or remodeled shall bear in a permanent position thereon a clearly legible identification plate stating the name and address of the owner of the sign the person or firm responsible for its construction and erection and the date of erection electrical signs shall be marked with input amperages at the full load input f clearance from high voltage power lines  signs shall be located in such a way that they maintain a clearance of ten feet from all overhead electrical conductors and a threefoot clearance from all secondary voltage service drops g ground sign materials  all ground sign structures shall be selfsupported structures erected on and attached to concrete foundations such structures shall be fabricated only from galvanized steel or of an equivalent corrosion resistant material h electric signs  all electric signs shall be certified by the sign contractor that the sign meets standards established by the current edition of the national electric electric signs shall be erected and installed by a licensed sign contractor the electrical connection to a power source shall be performed by a licensed electrical contractor i supports and braces  metal supports and braces shall be adequate for wind loadings wire or cable supports shall have a safety factor of four times the required strength all metal wire cable supports and braces and all bolts used to attach signs to brackets or brackets and signs to the supporting buildings or structures shall be of galvanized steel or of an equivalents corrosion resistant material all such sign supports shall be an integral part of the sign j sign anchoring  no sign shall be suspended by chains or other devices that will allow the sign to swing due to wind action signs shall be anchored to prevent any lateral movement that would cause wear on supporting members or connections k prohibited sign face materials for permanent ground and pole signs  the following materials are included among the materials which shall be generally prohibited for use as a sign face for a permanent ground or pole sign due to their lack of durability likelihood of losing original shape or other undesirable features plywood particle board masonite paper fabric etc however if it is shown to the satisfaction of the chief building official that an otherwise prohibited material has been modified or packaged to eliminate any unacceptable characteristics he may on a casebycase basis allow the material to be used 8 modifications to existing signs modifications of existing conforming signs may be permitted under the following conditions a modifications shall be subject to the applicable provisions of this modifications which alter height or sign area shall require a sign permit c modifications shall be consistent and compatible with the existing sign including illumination materials shape and style 9 lighting generally a floor or ground lights or spot lights used for the illumination of signs or otherwise shall be shielded from the street and adjacent property b neon use of neon signs and decorative neon on signs for increased visibility shall be permitted except that exposed unshielded neon shall be prohibited in residential zones use of nonsign neon to embellish or accent the outside of a building or other exterior exposure of a structure shall be limited as follows 1 plans shall be submitted to the community development department and a permit secured  and 2 such use of neon shall be limited to properties along arterial roadways  and 3 such use of neon shall be limited to trim along the edges of a structure  and 4 the neon plan must be approved by the board of adjustment and appeals after the board receives staff input and before a permit may be issued 10 overhanging public property no sign except bench advertising and franchised signage authorized by the city council shall overhang any city or public property g permitted signs 1 residential districts the owners or agents of any property in any residential district are hereby prohibited from erecting replacing or moving onto any property any sign or advertisement except as follows a one professional sign per lot only if required by state statute not exceeding two square feet in area subject sign shall list only the name of the individual business person and the occupation an occupational sign may only be erected at the residence where the occupation is conducted b real estate sales or rental signs as described and limited in real estate signs of this a subdivision identification entrance sign may be erected at one or more entrances to new subdivisions only if detailed plans and drawings showing the planned location size and type of sign are submitted to the city with the subdivision plan and development plans for their review and approval owners or agents for established subdivisions wishing to change existing entrance signs or erect new signs shall submit detailed plans to the city staff a homeowners association or similar entity shall exist or be created to maintain said signs d multifamily structures may erect one project identification sign not to exceed 32 square feet in area such sign shall be an unlighted or lighted ground sign suitably landscaped to blend with the area an ornamental entrance way may be provided if plans are submitted and approved with the original site plan and engineering drawings ornamental lettering depicting the project name and street address only may be placed on the side wall of a multifamily structure provided such wall faces a public street multifamily projects with more than one building fronting on a public street with each building having separate access to the street may use individual wall and entrance identification as outlined above one or more directionaldirectory signs not to exceed four square feet each may be approved to identify public areas within any project e garage sale signs one sign of not more than four square feet may be displayed on the property of the residence where a garage sale is being conducted pursuant to city ordinance  one additional such sign may be displayed offpremises the offpremises sign shall be placed only where indicated on the permit such sign shall be displayed only during the times permitted by city ordinance and only on the date or dates for which the permit is valid such sign may be displayed on a public rightofway where not otherwise prohibited by law f houses of worship in residential zoning districts electing to erect freestanding signage may be permitted a ground sign only as follows 1 the sign shall be limited to 32 square feet per sign face 64 square feet aggregate 2 there shall be a limit of 3 the signs may be electric or nonelectric  however they shall not be illuminated between the hours of  pm and  am 4 the height of the ground sign shall be limited to a maximum of eight feet and the impractical because it would physically impede the use of the related building such a roof sign is in lieu of the otherwise allowable wall signage and is limited in size to 36 square feet a roof sign square feet if a commercial or industrial structure has more than one wall readily visible from a public rightofway or street or if it is located on a corner lot one additional wall sign may be added for each visible wall with a maximum limit of three wall signs per structure  provided that the total area of all such signs shall not exceed sixty 60 square feet decorative facia not containing additional requirements in all cases a wall or roof sign may not extend above the roofline of the structure to which it is attached 3 multitenant buildings and multibuilding complexes each tenant in business is in a building that has more than one wall readily visible from a street one additional wall sign may be permitted the additional wall sign may not exceed the area of the primary sign and the total area of both signs shall not exceed 60 square feet roof signs shall not be permitted for multitenant buildings or multibuilding complexes 4 murals shall be regulated as wall signage in the following manner a murals that do not violate the size limitations for regular wall signage will be administratively processed just like any other wall signage b neon or other tubular gas lighting of any kind shall not be allowed as part of any type of mural c any mural must have a readily apparent relationship to the nature of the business at that location d the applicant for a mural shall be encouraged to limit its size to that of regularly allowed wall signage e murals proposed to be larger than regularly allowed wall signage must be considered by the land development regulation board ldrb using the following guidelines 1 staff must present its analysis and recommendation to the ldrb before the board makes its decision  2 the applicant must demonstrate that there is good reason for having a mural larger that a normal wall sign  3 the size of the mural shall not exceed 50 percent of the area of the wall where it is to be placed  4 the color scheme of the mural must be approved by the ldrb  5 a mural shall not contain more than a small amount of wording  6 murals larger that a normal wall sign shall be limited in location to arterial roadways ie beville rd us1 and nova rd  7 if a mural is larger than a normal wall sign no other business sign shall be allowed on the mural wall  8 a mural shall not pose a potential traffic hazard distraction  9 if the applicants proposal is denied by the ldrb and a variance or appeal from the decision of that board is sought the variance or appeal request shall be submitted to the board of adjustments and appeals 5 window signs a window sign defined a window sign is considered a wall sign and means any sign placed upon an exterior window of a building and includes any sign placed upon the outside or the inside of the window for purposes of viewing from the outside of the window b window signage shall not cover more than onethird of the window surface c signage located on the inside of a building and directly viewable from outside the window is considered window signage if it is located within three feet of the inside of the window even though it may not be attached to the window d since window signage is considered wall signage the area of such a sign counts against the total area of wall signage allowed e there shall be no limit on the number of window signs allowed on any one window  however the area of all such window signs counts against the total area of wall signage allowed f window signage on the inside of a particular window is not to be considered separately from window signage on the outside of that windoweg if signage on the inside of a window covers a certain onethird of the window and another is placed on the outside of the window covering a different onethird of the window taken together they must be considered in violation of the requirement that no more than onethird of the window space shall be covered with window signage b freestanding signs ground or pole signs 1 one ground or pole sign may be permitted subject to the following conditions a a singletenant or multitenant building may be permitted one freestanding sign shopping center outparcels shall be treated in the same manner b shopping centers or commercial and industrial parcels with more than one building may be permitted one freestanding sign for each 150 linear feet of street frontage up to a maximum of three such signs per property in single ownership 2 the maximum size of any freestanding sign shall be as specified in table 16 with the exception that the maximum size of any freestanding sign in a business neighborhood commercial bnc district shall be limited to 20 square feet 3 multiple frontage lots are permitted one additional freestanding sign the size of this sign is based upon the classification of the second street as follows street classification percent of primary sign arterial 100% collector 75% local street 50% 4 pole signs must have at least eight feet clearance between the bottom of the sign and the ground the maximum height of pole signs shall be 15 feet except that for shopping centers the maximum height shall be 20 feet 5 freestanding signs shall be located so as to avoid any visual interference with ingress and egress for the site 6 only one freestanding sign per tract shall be allowed within 75 feet of intersections 7 the minimum setback from the street rightofway shall be five feet unless the chief building official determines that a lesser setback is necessary to avoid impeding the physical use of the property 8 notwithstanding other size limitations in this freestanding theater advertising signs in shopping centers shall be subject to the following size limitations the total sign area shall not exceed 250 square feet with the theater the ridgewood redevelopment district cra shall be ground signs ie monument signs as defined in this code unless a hardship variance is obtained from the board of adjustments and appeals all nonground freestanding signs installed prior to the effective date of this provision shall be allowed to continue to exist until one of the following events occursafter which such signs must be promptly removed 1 a period of ten years goes by after the date that this article takes effect this is also known as an amortization period  2 the sign is damaged to the extent of 50 percent or more of its assessed value as determined by the volusia county property appraiser  3 the sign deteriorates to the extent that its assessed value as determined by the volusia county property appraiser has been reduced to 25 percent or less of its replacement cost  or 4 the sign is being replaced with another freestanding sign ordinary repair and maintenance shall be allowed on existing nonground signs 3 signs in signs this section shall govern the erection and display of political signs within the city and shall not be construed to apply to signs of any other nature which are regulated by other laws of the city a permits are required for any candidate desiring to erect or display a political sign or signs within the city such a permit shall be issued to the applicant by the city upon payment of a permit fee in the amount of $1000 and the posting of a $10000 cash bond for municipal election candidates and a $2500 bond for nonmunicipal election candidates the obligation of said bond shall be the applicants compliance with the provisions of this division and all other applicable law b no such signs shall be erected or displayed earlier than 30 days prior to the primary special or general election to which the same is directed each such sign shall be removed within seven days after such election except that the signs for a winning candidate in a primary election may be maintained until seven 7 days after the general election c no such signs shall be erected or displayed on public sidewalks on public rightsofway or on any other public property additionally no sign shall be attached to or on any telephone telegraph utility pole public signage structure tree or shrubbery d no such signs shall be erected or displayed on private property without the consent of the owner of the property e no such sign shall be displayed in such a manner as to obstruct the vision of motorists at street intersections or to otherwise create a safety hazard f no such sign shall exceed four square feet per side in area in any residential zone or 32 square feet in area in any commercial or industrial zone g residents of the city shall be permitted to display on the property on which they reside a maximum of five political signs without obtaining a sign permit or posting the bond required herein the erection or display of such signs shall be subject to the regulations and restrictions set forth herein h signs displayed in violation of the provisions of this section may be removed by a representative of the city without notice any person violating the provisions of this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be subject to a fine in the amount of $500 for each sign in violation in the event that signs are erected or displayed by holders of political sign permits in violation of the provisions of this the bond posted by the permit holder pursuant to the code may be used for the removal of such signs at the rate of $500 per sign 2 special event advertising in commercial and industrial zones and after city council approval in specified residential areas the use of temporary signs banner signs and pennants to promote an extraordinary business event such as a grand opening goingoutofbusiness sale or race week promotion shall be permitted for a limited time no business or nonprofit entity may utilize any of the temporary signs permitted herein for more than 30 days in any calendar year the permit for the use of a temporary sign shall specify the day the signs shall be erected and the day the signs shall be removed all temporary signs shall be reinforced at their attaching points and the cables wires or ropes used to support such signs must be of a size and material to be safe and capable of withstanding adverse weather conditions all temporary signs shall be contained within the property boundaries or lease area of the business the sign advertises and no sign or cable shall be attached to any telegraph telephone or utility pole no sign permitted herein shall be permitted to be located in the same location for more than 30 continuous days no matter what business is utilizing the sign if a sign permitted herein is to be used by more than one business when those businesses are located on the same property of lease area the sign must be completely removed from the property or lease area on which the businesses are located for a period of at least seven days prior to its utilization by the second business if the sign permitted herein has not been removed for at least seven days prior to its utilization by the second business no permit shall be issued  and the sign shall be treated as if no permit has been issued and the penalty provisions of this apply no sign permitted herein shall be erected until approved by the community development department and payment of the permit fees temporary signs shall be erected no earlier than two days prior to the special event and shall be removed no later than two days after its termination in no case shall any business be allowed to utilize any type of sign or combination of signs permitted under this section for more than 30 days within a calendar year failure of any business to comply with the terms of this section shall subject the permittee to the penalty and enforcement provisions of the ordinances as such provisions may be applicable 3 real estate signs in any residential zoning district of the city or any subdivision thereof the property owner or any real estate agent broker or salesperson is hereby prohibited from regulations 1 awnings a illuminated awnings use of awnings shall be regulated under the following 1 the use of copy on an awning and illuminated awnings shall be regulated by the applicable provisions information signage on awnings shall be treated as wall signage 2 a master sign plan is required for a shopping or multibuilding complex as noted herein and should be included in the development plans submitted for review 3 traffic control signs such as enter exit oneway stop etc are allowed to the extent necessary to properly control onsite traffic flow mutcd standards shall apply other signs may contain logo and shall not exceed two square feet all traffic control signs must be approved as part of the master sign plan 4 directory signage is allowed in multibuilding commercial industrial or multifamily complexes to identify locations by building these may be wall or freestanding signs freestanding signs must be a ground sign directory signs shall not exceed 15 square feet 5 flags a no more than three flags or insignia of governmental charitable religious fraternal or other organizations may be displayed on any one parcel of land the maximum width from top to bottom of any flag model open open house or any other phrase which identifies property for sale or lease purposes may be displayed as noted in the real estate section of this chapter the maximum height of such flags of a planned residential development  two flags 3 singlefamily or duplex model home lot  two flags 4 townhouse or villa model  two flags 6 bus benches and shelters nothing contained in this be construed to prohibit the placement or construction of bus benches or bus shelters in connection with public transportation and from the painting or attachment of signs thereto  provided however that such bus benches and bus shelters upon which signs are painted or attached shall be placed or constructed under and pursuant to the terms of a license agreement or other contract executed on behalf of the city wherein the conditions concerning the placement design construction number and signage connected with such bus benches and bus shelters as applicable shall be set forth 7 parking of vehicles used for advertising purposes no person shall park any car truck trailer boat or other vehicle on a public rightofway public property or private property so as to be clearly visible from a public right ofway which has attached thereto or located thereon any sign or advertising device for the primary purpose of providing advertisement of products or directing people to a business or business activity this provision is not intended to prohibit any form of public vehicular signage such as a sign attached to a public bus neither shall this provision be a sign lettered on or attached to a motor vehicle in a manner to primarily identify the vehicle with the business it serves so long as the sign is less than six square feet in area and the vehicle is regularly used for transportation in the conduct of the business 8 nonconforming signs any sign which is rendered nonconforming by the enactment of these sign regulations shall be allowed to continue in a nonconforming status under the following conditions a nonconforming signs shall be maintained and repaired until their elimination date but they shall not be structurally or mechanically extended or altered to further the nonconformity replacement or repainting of the sign face shall be permitted b tolerance provision existing nonconforming signs with reference to their existing dimensions shall be allowed to exceed the height and size standards of this a degree not exceeding 25 percent for the life of the sign c nonconforming signs shall be classified as either type a in excess of three freestanding pole or ground signs per property under single ownership or type b other it should be noted that type b signs include up to three nonconforming freestanding signs per property and all wall and roof signs d type a signs the in excess of three freestanding signs per property category shall be allowed to retain their nonconforming status until  the elimination date at which time all such nonconforming signs shall be eliminated for example if a shopping center presently has seven nonconforming freestanding signs the owner must eliminate four of them within the approximately fiveyear period  however the remaining three signs would be classified as type b signs with a remaining life of approximately ten years e type b signs shall be allowed to retain their non conforming status until  the elimination date at which time all such nonconforming signs shall be eliminated except for those for which the sole nonconformity is that they do not meet the fivefoot setback requirement see provision 8f below f the fivefoot setback requirement shall be tied to any substantial change in the building to which the subject sign is related any type b sign whose sole nonconformity is a violation of the fivefoot setback requirement shall be allowed to retain its nonconforming status until such time as a substantial change in the building occurs the term substantial change shall include but not be limited to such phenomena as replacing the existing building with a new one substantial exterior remodeling or modernization of the existing building or putting an addition on the existing building the term substantial change shall not include such activities as repair and maintenance including painting a fivefoot setback only non conforming sign could last beyond the usual elimination date for a type b sign if there is no substantial change in the related building by that date however type a signs are not eligible for fivefoot setback only consideration g any nonconforming sign shall be brought into conformance if the sign is damaged to the extent of 50 percent or more of its assessed value as determined by the volusia county property appraiser h any nonconforming sign shall be brought into conformance if the sign deteriorates to the extent that its assessed value as determined by the volusia county property appraiser becomes 25 percent or less of
