communitybased advice concerning such matters as reviewing proposed changes to the sign code and finding solutions to problems encountered in implementing the sign code some but not all of the members of this committee shall be business persons doing business in the city of south daytona this committee may provide advice and recommendations to the city but it shall have no power to require action vacating rightsofway the city council may at any time convey by quitclaim deed any part or all of a street alley or other public rightofway when it appears to the council to be right and just for the purpose of fixing the proper location of any property or correcting the description thereof or disposing of a rightofway that is unused and that the city has no plans to use in the foreseeable future the city council has the authority to transfer all rights owned by the city or to retain a lesser property interest such as an easement and to transfer the property interest not retained 6 obstructing streets no person shall block or in any manner obstruct any street or alley by placing anything therein or thereon or otherwise or by using such street or alley for any purpose which might inconvenience or injure passersby no one shall place or deposit or permit to be placed or deposited or to remain in front of his place of business or property any article of any description which person removing a wrecked or damaged vehicle from street or highway shall remove any glass or other injurious substance dropped or deposited upon the street or alley from such vehicle 8 drainage into streets if it is within his control no person or owner of property shall allow water or other liquids to run onto the streets or alleys within the city it shall be the duty of all owners of real estate within the city to make adequate provision for the drainage of all surface water from their property to prevent such water from drainage onto and standing in any such street or alley waivers of these requirements may be granted by the city manager under such exceptional circumstances as heavy rainfall events 9 vehicles boats trailers and recreational vehicles offered for sale on public in their appropriate relation to the proposed uses of the land to be served by such streets 2 where such is not shown in the general community plan the arrangement of streets in a subdivision shall either a provide for the continuation of existing principal streets into surrounding areas or b conform to a plan for the neighborhood approved or adopted by the city council 3 no street grades shall be less than 020 percent 4 the minimum street widths cross sections curbs and gutters and construction standards as are set out in this grass drainage swales and paved entrance driveways an exception to the requirement for street curbs may be made in those instances when it can be shown by the detailed plans and specifications prepared by a registered engineer that the street grades and drainage swale grades will be not less than 06 percent and the storm and surface drainage plan prepared will be adequate and comparable with that designed for curbed streets and roads 6 all streets which are part of a subdivision shall be adequately lighted with a street lighting system which shall be approved by the city and representatives of florida power and light as to the number and wattage of the lights a street light shall be located at each intersection in no case shall the lights be more than 300 feet apart the system shall be installed by florida power and light the street lighting system once public dedication of streets parks etc takes place while under the ownership of florida power and light shall be treated as all other systems in the city except lantern park all electric charges shall be paid by the city after dedication the developer shall be required to arrange for the installation of approved street light systems in all new subdivisions c technical specifications and construction methods streets roads and alley construction materials and construction methods shall conform to the standard specifications for road and bridge construction of the florida state department of transportation as per the latest issue at the time of the subdivision application for plat approval d specifications for sidewalk construction 1 sidewalk specifications a all sidewalks shall be a minimum fourfoot wide sidewalks shall be constructed within the rightofway abutting the adjacent property line so as to allow maximum parkage area between sidewalk and street the parkage width shall generally be no less than six feet at no time shall a sidewalk adjoin the curb easements and rightsofway shall be required to allow for such placements b the subbase for sidewalks shall be a good clean acceptable material compacted to 95 percent aashto t180 of maximum density sidewalks shall be constructed of at least 3000 psi 28day natural concrete with a minimum thickness of four inches c a onehalfinch expansion joint shall separate the sidewalk and driveway the sidewalk and driveway apron and the driveway apron and curb in addition an expansion joint shall be installed along the sidewalk length at spacings not to exceed 60 feet tooled contraction joints shall be cut at fourfoot intervals for fourfoot wide sidewalks and at fivefoot intervals for fivefoot wide sidewalks d sidewalks shall be constructed on all unimproved properties regardless of zoning category upon development the city council may waive this requirement if it determines that the construction of sidewalks is unnecessary or unfeasible 2 pedestrian crosswalks not less than four feet wide shall be required where deemed essential to provide circulation or access to schools playgrounds shopping centers transportation and other community facilities e maintenance of parkage areas 1 it shall be the duty and responsibility of every owner of real property within the city to at all times maintain those areas of parkage most nearly abutting their property these duties and responsibilities shall include cutting and mowing grass and weeds cutting and trimming flowers vines shrubbery and trees not exceeding six feet in height so as to maintain a neat trim appearance in such areas more specifically grass shall be mowed to within three inches of the ground at least once a month during the months of may at least once every two months during the remaining period of the year weeds shall be removed at least once every two months vines shrubbery and trees not exceeding six feet in height shall be trimmed as required to maintain a neat appearance but in no event less often than twice a year 2 it shall be the further duty of every property owner to remove any and all refuse or other debris at any time located within adjacent parkage 3 property owners shall not be required to maintain trees exceeding six feet in height that exist within parkages 4 no person shall plant or remove any tree or shrubbery from any parkage unless written permission is requested in writing and received in writing from the city manager or his designee south ridgewood avenue corridor design guidelines a purpose and intent to ensure that private development projects implement the goals objectives policies and vision for the south ridgewood corridor in order to improve the citys appearance environment and community welfare b applicability the south ridgewood avenue corridor design guidelines shall apply to private development and improvement activities on properties abutting south ridgewood avenue c guidelines the south ridgewood avenue corridor design guidelines establish standards for driveways parking areas pedestrian circulation stormwater ponds site lighting signage landscaping building design and the placement of buildings and accessory structures on a site the specific guideline provisions are adopted by resolution of the south daytona city council and included herein by reference  52708 article ix  legal requirements inclusion of south daytona consolidated land development regulations the south daytona consolidated land development regulations have been adopted in their entirety and included as in the ordinances of the city of south daytona florida provisions of land development regulations declared to be minimum requirements in their interpretation and application the provisions of these land development regulations shall be held to be minimum requirements adopted for the protection of the public health safety morals and general welfare whenever the requirements of these regulations are at variance with the requirements of any other lawfully adopted rules regulations ordinances deed restriction or covenants these regulations shall govern enforcement provisions a complaints regarding violations 1 complaint whenever a violation of these regulations occurs or is alleged to have occurred any person may file a complaint such complaint shall state fully the causes and basis thereof and shall be filed with the community development director he shall properly record such complaint and immediately investigate and take action thereon as provided herein 2 notice of violation when the city determines that development activity is not being carried out in accordance with the requirements of these regulations the city shall issue a written notice of violation to the owner of record of the property the notice of violation shall contain a the name and address of the owner or applicant  b the street address when available or a description of the building structure or land upon which the violation is occurring  c a statement specifying the nature of the violation  d a description of the remedial actions necessary to bring the development activity into compliance with these regulations and a time schedule for completion of such remedial action  e a statement of the penalty or penalties that shall or may be assessed against the person to whom the notice of violation is directed  the notice of violation shall be served upon the persons to whom it is directed either personally in the manner provided for personal service of notices in court or by mailing a copy of the notice of violation by certified mail postage prepaid return receipt requested to such person at his or her last known address 3 restoration the violator may be required to restore any altered conditions of the land to their undisturbed condition in the event that restoration is not undertaken within a reasonable time after notice the city may take necessary corrective action the cost of which shall become a lien upon the property until paid b miscellaneous violations and penalties for any and every violation of the provisions of this the owner general agent or contractor of the building or premises where such violation has been committed or exists and the lessee or tenant of an entire building or entire premises where such violation has been committed or exists and the owner general agent contractor lessee or tenant of any part of a building or premise in which part such violation has been committed or exists and the general agent architect builder contractor subcontractor or any person who commits takes part in or assists such violation or who maintains any building or premises in which any such violation shall exist shall for each and every violation and for each and every day or part thereof that such violation continues be subject to a fine of not more than $50000 at the discretion of the circuit court judge or the code enforcement board legal remedies for violations shall be had and violations shall be prosecuted in the same manner as is prescribed by law or ordinance for the prosecution of violations of other ordinances of the city of south daytona c penalties for violating dock provisions any person firm or corporation who undertakes any of the activities specified herein without obtaining the required permit from the city shall have 72 hours from the date of written notice from the city to file an application for an afterthefact permit applicants for an afterthefact permit shall be required to pay double the normal permit fee and shall further be required to correct any irregularities in order to make the structure comply with the standards of this board ceb violations stemming from this be prosecuted before the ceb as duly authorized by the city remedies in case any building or structure is erected constructed reconstructed altered repaired converted or maintained or any building structure or land is used in violation of this ordinance or any other ordinance or lawful regulation the proper authorities of the city in addition to the remedies herein provided may institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent such unlawful erection construction reconstruction alteration repair conversion maintenance or use or impose a penalty for such violation or restrain correct or abate such violation in order to prevent the occupancy or use of such building structure or land contrary to the provisions hereof or prevent any illegal act conduct business or use in or about such premises the chief building official is empowered to use the following penalties to seek the remedy of violations stop work order  withhold a certificate of occupancy  and double permit fees in addition to the criminal penalties provided herein any person who violates any provision for tree protection shall forfeit and pay to the city of south daytona a civil penalty equal to the total value of those trees illegally removed or damaged as computed from the international society of arboriculture shadetreevalue formula said sum shall accrue to the city of south daytona and may be recovered in a civil action brought by the city the sum so collected shall be placed in a fund for the tree bank and shall be expended for the purchase of trees for placement on public properties in the city of south daytona replacement of illegally removed trees may be required as restoration in lieu of money this replacement will be computed on an inch for inch ratio based on the total diameter measured at dbh in inches of the illegally removed trees a combination of money and trees may be required list of tables table 1 capacity management processiv3 table 2 permitted uses by
